It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they're doing!  We're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business.   About Kyriba    Kyriba is the global leader in Proactive Treasury Management. Our SaaS treasury and risk solutions   enable finance teams to optimize their cash, manage their risk, and work their capital. Our award-winning cash, treasury, payment, risk management and supply chain finance solutions are   used by more than 1 300 leading organizations worldwide, including Amway, Electronic Arts, PulteGroup, and Qualcomm, to unlock new business value, drive growth and ensure compliance.   Kyriba was established in 2000 and has over 700 employees, serving more than 2000 clients worldwide.   Headquartered in San Diego, Kyriba also has offices in New York, Paris, London, Tokyo, Hong Kong and Rio de Janeiro.    Essential Duties and Responsibilities:    Reporting to the Director Kyriba Academy, the position is tasked with assisting in standardizing the delivery process and performing the value-add services of the Kyriba Academy, such as, enable project team members and deliver custom ad-hoc projects.   This person will be responsible for assisting in the development of quantitative and qualitative metrics to increase Kyriba Employees’ knowledge of the application. Acting as the Subject Matter Expert in gathering requirements and developing solutions to address client needs are also essential to this role.  Training  Proactively leads in-person and virtual training on specific modules to internal consultant, product engineers and partners. Coordinates internal campaigns to maintain awareness of Kyriba’s new and emerging capabilities and the potential application on client engagements. Contributes and assists in the creation of collateral for trainings. Consultant Development Mentors those partners or internal consultants with less experience through formal channels. Seeks and participates in development opportunities above and beyond standard Kyriba training.   Design and Development ELMS Content  Creating applicational training in multiple, engaging written and video formats; and creating collaboration learning opportunities to spread knowledge globally. Conducts examinations on the deliverables of specific workflows to ensure they are prepared according to standard before presenting to the client.   Education, Experience & Skills:  Possesses a thorough understanding of Kyriba Modules capabilities. A bachelors degree plus 3 to 8 years of experience in managing the Kyriba application. 40% travel to Kyriba training sites and meetings is required. Experience identifying, analyzing and disseminating best practices across a network of partners. High level of organization is required; experience in program management is a plus. Ability to develop, document and communicate project timelines and processes and to manage geographically and organizationally dispersed stakeholders through them. Excellent oral and written communication skills and the ability to communicate complex data, findings and ideas clearly.   Kyriba Culture and Values    At Kyriba, we value a strong work culture and sense of community and ownership among our global team. We live by our “iCare” value system to demonstrate our care and commitment to our clients and to each other. In hiring, we look for candidates that are a strong fit with our culture and values, as well as bring the talent and experience required by the position.    Innovation: We foster innovation and entrepreneurial thinking across our team by rewarding employees for their achievements and encouraging efficiency and continual process improvement.    Customer Success: Our passion is to enable our Customers’ success. We do this by understanding their needs and developing and managing solutions that provide them the insight to effectively drive decision making within their organizations.    Accountability: We each take personal responsibility for our actions. We are committed to our own continuous improvement, and we go the extra mile to meet our Customers’ needs.    Respect: We respect each other’s ideas, efforts and commitments, and embrace our diverse cultures and points of view. We achieve our goals through teamwork, responsiveness, open communication and a positive attitude.    Excellence: We strive for excellence in all that we do and bring the passion and commitment to deliver on our promises. We achieve excellence through leadership, teamwork, transparency and integrity, and we are committed to recognizing employee achievements.

Job Title Senior QA Engineer-White Hat  Summary of the role: As White Hat, you will be the link between the Application Security Office and the Engineering community and ensure facilitation of SDL deployment by embarking Dev & QA in those activities. The Airline Solutions Engineering division, part of Travel Unit, is accountable for the optimal delivery of the technology and solutions required to achieve the Altea business objectives. The group encompasses under the same umbrella several domains and a large set of activities: Offer, Order and Traveler Touchpoints & Experience (former Digital for Airlines), Services, and Transversal RnD. Within Altea Engineering, Offer is responsible of IT solutions for airlines: we are building offers both adapted to the end-user (with the right price and flexibility) and that maximize airlines revenue. The area is tech-savvy! We build upon technology: Performance for example is key to make sure flight search transactions are fast, efficient, and cost effective; Data processing and machine learning are used across our solutions, to optimize our search, power our dynamic pricing and forecast airline’s revenue management. We have a rich ecosystem of applications, OBE, data, OJF or cloud native Skube.On the business side, we work on a stimulating mix of critical Airline Solution functionalities like airline search or inventory, and new solutions with a great commercial dynamic like, revenue management, dynamic pricing, or Altea NDC. One key mission of the Airline Solutions Engineering group is to enable and support our customers in the retailing transformation and to deliver our airline retailing vision: Nevio the future of the PSS (formerly known as Next-Gen Altéa, Nevio)! Within Airline Solution, Offer is really at the heart of this transformation: we are building the new Offer Management System with a platform-oriented approach, creating from scratch several new components with a state-of-the-art microservice/event driven approach! As POD organization white hat, you will be part of a transversal team (PQT) made of 10 very engaged people delivering activities as QA, DevOps, SMs and POs within SAFe Agile teams, with a high level of diversity in team members composition, and sharing the same mission to bring our solutions to the next level. In this role you'll: Execute You execute Secured Development Lifecycle activities and track delegated activities (Threats modelling, Source code scans, Binary scans and Dynamic scans), provide support to the development teams and report to the management. You contribute to the PCI-DSS audits and coordinate remediation actions. You perform the vulnerabilities investigations to categorize them and design/implement resolution with the different development teams. You are working closely with the Offer security contact point to define the priorities and the roadmaps. Learn You attend trainings and Software Security Community to be fluent in SDL activities and Software Security You practice the use of security tools & activities You keep up-to-date regarding new Vulnerabilities found in third parties software (FWK, OSS, Products) Teach You promote SDL methodology & tools to improve adoption. You train and coach the Dev and QA to let them implement SDL-related activities. You share return and experience in the Software Security Community to support other white hats and security engineers. Common accountabilities You have working experience and advanced and specialized technical/functional knowledge in own discipline. You understand how your own area contributes to the business and acts as a reference for colleagues with less experience and supports junior team members. You influences decisions, anticipating dependencies and consequences in complex scenarios, contribute to transversal projects, propose improvements to processes and are accountable for own and team commitments. You work independently within plan dictated by management, with some guidance on most complex situations. About the ideal candidate Few years of experience with advanced and specialized technical/functional knowledge in Software Development. Software Security enthusiast, able to understands how own area contributes to the business and acts as a reference for colleagues with less experience and supports junior team members. IT enthusiast, keen on learning new things and on putting them in actions by himself, like assets deployment on the public cloud, handling pipelines, or pulling from a data lake. Comfortable with cloud environment, proficient in REST APIs. Autonomous and able to connect with people out of his organization. Influence decisions related to own activity and federate people. University degree or equivalent experience. Excellent English verbal and written communication skills. Working at Amadeus, you will find A critical mission and purpose - At Amadeus, you will be powering the future of travel and pursuing a critical mission and extraordinary purpose. A truly global DNA - Everything at Amadeus is global, from our people to our business, which translates into our footprint, processes, and culture. Great opportunities to learn - Learning happens all the time and in many ways at Amadeus, through on-the-job training, formal learning activities, and day-to-day interactions with colleagues. A caring environment - Amadeus fosters a caring environment, nurturing both a fulfilling career and personal and family life. We care about our employees and strive to provide a supportive work environment. A complete rewards offer - Amadeus provides attractive remuneration packages, covering all essential components of a competitive reward offer, including salary, bonus, equity, and benefits. A flexible working model - We want our employees to do their best work, wherever and however it works best for them. A diverse and inclusive community - We are committed to leveraging our uniquely diverse population to drive innovation, creativity, and collaboration across our organization. A Reliable Company - Trust and reliability are fundamental values that drive our actions and shape long-lasting relationships with our customers, partners, and employees. #LI-EMEA Application process The application process takes no longer than 10 minutes! Create your candidate profile, upload your CV and apply. Once we’ve received your application, one of our recruiters will get in touch with you to arrange an interview. Diversity & Inclusion Amadeus aspires to be a leader in Diversity, Equity and Inclusion in the tech industry, enabling every employee to reach their full potential by fostering a culture of belonging and fair treatment, attracting the best talent from all backgrounds, and as a role model for an inclusive employee experience. Amadeus is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender, race, ethnicity, sexual orientation, age, beliefs, disability or any other characteristics protected by law.

Job Title Associate Software Development Engineer C++     External Job Advert   Business Environment The Search, Shopping and Pricing (SSP) division develops products designed to serve multiple customer segments: providers (airlines, alliances, and railway operators), distributors (travel agencies, online travel agencies, tour operators) and new intermediaries (meta-search). The market is innovative, with a strong push from the online players (Google/ITA, Kayak, Expedia …), competitors (Vayant, Sabre) and significant business model evolutions (NDC). The platform supporting these processes is of massive scale in infrastructure (100 000 cores computing the transactions), in operations (25 000 transactions per second), in data (350 million of fares, petabyte scale historical data sets), and in software (23 million lines of code). Your Main Responsibilities Common accountabilities : Engage in the design and development of software solutions using modern C++, ensuring they meet the evolving needs of the travel industry. Analyze specifications to define user requirements for new or enhanced software solutions. About Amadeus Amadeus’s mission is to power better journeys through technology, connecting the global travel ecosystem and enabling all players to deliver enriched travel experiences. Contribute to our Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) pipeline, enhancing the efficiency and reliability of our development process. Collaborate with a diverse team to debug and refine our products, ensuring they meet customer needs. Document your contributions, ensuring clarity and continuity in our development processes. About Amadeus Amadeus’s mission is to power better journeys through technology, connecting the global travel ecosystem and enabling all players to deliver enriched travel experiences. Specific accountabilities : 0-2 years of experience in C++. Effective communication skills. Knowledge of Agile Scrum (advantageous). Knowledge of SAFe (advantageous). Experience with Java (beneficial). What we can offer you Be rewarded with a competitive remuneration, an individual and company bonus and enjoy many benefits. Work from anywhere: Flexible teleworking from 1 to 3 days per week. You will also benefit from a home office set-up premium & monthly allowance. 6 weeks holiday, plus pension contribution and healthcare insurance. Experience in an environment with unique complexity and a hardly matched criticality among the leading tech companies. Professional development in a truly international and multisite environment with a great mix of people. A wide set of trainings available to broaden your knowledge and enhance your soft skills including onsite and on-line learning hubs packed of technical and soft skills to help to develop any competencies. Enter a diverse and inclusive workplace. Enjoy your office life: Coffee hubs to work or relax, quiet zone, flexible desks and agile areas, on site restaurants, tennis, soccer, yoga, dance, on-site sport center and classes and on-site concierge services. How do we hire? Online application: Submit your online application and our Talent Acquisition team will get in touch if your skills match the role. Phone Interview: We'll get to know each other with a short casual conversation. You'll also have the chance to ask questions. Online Testing: Depending on the role you applied for, you may have to do some online tests. Interviews: First, you'll meet one of our talent teams. Then you'll have an interview with a member or members of the team you're looking to join. Offer: Our Talent team will make you a job offer and welcome you to your new role with us. Join our global team: Where you can develop your skills and build an international career that matters. 100% of the people we’ve recruited started by applying. Take a chance! Diversity & Inclusion Amadeus aspires to be a leader in Diversity, Equity and Inclusion in the tech industry, enabling every employee to reach their full potential by fostering a culture of belonging and fair treatment, attracting the best talent from all backgrounds, and as a role model for an inclusive employee experience. Amadeus is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender, race, ethnicity, sexual orientation, age, beliefs, disability or any other characteristics protected by law.

Take a step forward and let Edenred surprise you.    Every day, we deliver innovative solutions to improve the life of millions of people, connecting employees, companies, and merchants all around the world.    We know there are hundred ways for you to grow. With us, you will expand your skills in a multicultural, challenging, and dynamic environment.    Dare to join Edenred and get ready to thrive in a global company that will offer you endless opportunities.    Edenred is all about meritocracy. You come as you are, and you contribute. Indeed, the Edenred Group recognizes, recruits and develops all talents and singularities.    We are committed to preventing all forms of discrimination and to providing all our candidates with equal opportunities regardless of their gender and gender expression, disability, origin, religious belief and sexual orientation or any other criteria.    We are seeking a Lead QA Engineer to drive quality our in cutting-edge web or mobile applications for high-volume, multi-country users. Join us to influence product excellence, advocate for automation, and lead our QA capabilities to new heights.    OUR TESTING & QA TEAM    Our Testing & QA team is critical to ensuring the reliability and performance of our products, while minimizing the toil for our engineering teams. Its mission is to be the quality adovcates of our products and services, and to continuously improve our processes and tools to deliver value to our customers. We have invested very early in Automation capabilities; we are driving very intentionally efficiency with an end-to-end mindset within our teams. We want our Testing & QA community to focus on 4 pillars :      Promote a “shift left” mindset for quality, ensuring the testing strategy is fully embedded in the Product delivery lifecycle, bringing an upfront focus on edge cases and accepting criteria, fostering the “3 amigos” approach        Design and implement robust End to End testing/QA strategies, to acknowledge the transversality and interdependency within our ecosystem, maximize our product reliability while enabling a high frequency release management        Embrace our data driven culture by promoting full transparency on testing KPIs, including functional coverage, automation and execution metrics        Establish a strong QA Community of Practice to ensure best practices and ways of working also reach our internal and external partners and contribute to elevate the Quality culture within Edenred      Our QA team work closely with the Engineering, Data and Product teams to ensure that our products meet the high standards of quality and performance that our customers expect.    We expect from our QA team leadership to be role models, master our products, be both functionally and technically savvy and capable of influencing both Product & Engineers within their respective Tribes.    We are fostering autonomy within each tribe and Lead QA engineers will be accountable to reconcile our SmartER QA driving principles, tools and methodologies with the specificities of the tribes, whether it comes from Technology (eg Mobile vs Web vs API vs Salesforce) or Functional complexity.    YOU WILL VIBE WITH US    As a lead QA Engineer, your main responsibilities will be:      Quality Leadership: Lead the QA strategy for web or mobile applications, ensuring high-quality standards across B2B or B2C products.        Shift-Left Testing: Influence the product team early in the development cycle, focusing on edge cases and acceptance criteria.        Collaboration: Work closely with developers to integrate quality practices throughout the development process.        Automation Advocacy: Champion test automation strategies, ensuring robust and efficient automated test coverage.        End-to-End Testing: Design and implement comprehensive end-to-end testing strategies for cloud-native architectures (APIs, Microservices).        Coaching: Act as a role model for QA engineers (2 to 4 within a Tribe), providing guidance and fostering a culture of continuous improvement.        Tool Utilization & Adoption: Leverage Jira and the Atlassian suite for test planning and execution and use Gherkin language for test scripting.        Cross-Functional Communication: Communicate effectively with team members, stakeholders, and across different geographical regions and languages.      WE WILL VIBE WITH YOU    You could be our next teammate if you have:      English fluent (a must)        5-8 years minimum of experience in software testing and QA        Leadership: Demonstrated ability to lead and mentor QA teams, fostering a culture of quality and continuous improvement.        Technical Proficiency: Strong hands-on experience in test automation tools and frameworks (e.g., Selenium, Appium, Cucumber).        Agile Experience: Proven experience in agile environments, with a focus on shift-left testing practices.        Cloud-Native Architecture: Experience testing cloud-native applications, including microservices and APIs.        High-Volume Applications: Experience working on products serving large user bases across multiple countries and languages.        End-to-End Testing: Strong background in both front-end (web/mobile) and back-end integration testing.        Collaboration Skills: Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with experience working in cross-functional teams.        Test Management Tools: Proficiency in using Jira and the Atlassian suite for test management.        Gherkin Language: Experience in writing and executing tests using Gherkin language.      Apply now and Vibe with Us!

At DuPont, we are working on things that matter; whether it’s providing clean water to more than a billion people on the planet, producing materials that are essential in everyday technology devices from smartphones to electric vehicles, or protecting workers around the world. If you would like to be a part of a premier multi-industrial company that is delivering sustainable solutions that bring real purpose and value, of a company with collaborative spirit because it believes that we work best when we work together as a team and values the diversity of thought, then DuPont is the company for you! WHY JOIN US? Our purpose is to empower the world with essential innovations to thrive. We work on things that matter! Have the Opportunity to chart your own course, challenge yourself, and acquire new capabilities to build a rewarding and fulfilling career. We reward employees with competitive pay and incentives to recognize skills, competencies, and contributions to business results. Get to Experience a collaborative environment where teamwork is celebrated with flexibility that enhances balance and an inclusive atmosphere that is welcoming to all! Get to know our Purpose and make it yours by bringing innovations to market that improve the world, share a commitment to sustainability that makes our planet better and give back to communities in which we work and live. DuPont Water Solutions (DWS) is a $1.4 B water technology leader, focused on solving global challenges in water purification, conservation, and reuse. DWS serves its thousands of customers in diverse markets using multiple technologies from its portfolio across major geographies of the world. We are seeking a knowledgeable and experienced Water Reuse Specialist to join our Technical Service and Development Team in EMEA. The primary focus of this role is to provide technical service and support in the design, implementation, and optimization of wastewater processes and technologies for municipal and industrial water reuse, working closely with customers, collaborators, commercial and marketing teams and other functions to develop customized solutions that meet specific water treatment needs. The target region is whole Europe with a focus on southern and eastern European countries. Your key responsibilities: Become a subject matter expert on water reuse application to position DWS’s products, providing technical guidance and consultation to internal teams (commercial) and external clients to ensure efficient and effective system designs, adequate operation and offer guidance during troubleshooting and resolution of operational issues. Present technical proposals and solutions and/or alternative to customers and address their queries and concerns, managing opportunities at any stage on technical level by using appropriate tools. Develop jointly with commercial and marketing engagement programs (action plans) for priority markets to increase business visibility and positioning as technology partner. Collaborate with customers to understand their water treatment requirements and develop customized solutions. Conduct feasibility studies, analyze water quality data, and recommend appropriate technology, equipment, and operating conditions to achieve desired treatment outcomes. Provide training and technical support to customers, operators, and field service personnel on the systems operation, maintenance, troubleshooting, and water reuse handling. Develop and deliver technical presentations and workshops and customer seminars as needed. Together with commercial and marketing organizations, explores and defines new markets / applications for existing products based on market feedback, regional needs and regulatory drivers. Provide feedback to strategic marketing, commercial and R&D for product improvement and development opportunities. Compile and updates product documentation material like case histories and customer success cases. Gives technical presentations and talks on conferences, exhibition, and customer seminars. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Chemical Engineering, Environmental Science, or a related field. A Master's degree or Ph.D. preferred (but not mandatory). Languages: English: highly proficient in both spoken and written + local language skills. 10 years of experience in technical functions, such as Technical Sales, Technical Service or Project Management in water treatment. Relevant technical experience with UF & RO Technologies. Understanding of water technologies (i.e: UF, RO/NF, biological and others) theory, and its practical application in water and water reuse space. Familiarity with water quality parameters, such as pH, conductivity, TDS, hardness, alkalinity, and contaminants commonly found in various water sources. Readiness to attend business trips, up to 25% of the time. Customer centric attitude and capability to build up customer relationship and trust. Important to have an attitude to identify and solve problems at customers systems. Excellent verbal and written communication skills to effectively interact with customers, internal teams, and stakeholders. Ability to explain complex technical concepts in a clear and concise manner. Strong in digital technology and data analysis. Good interpersonal skills and capability to work in a multinational environment. Join our Talent Community to stay connected with us! DuPont is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability or any other protected class. If you need a reasonable accommodation to search or apply for a position, please visit our Accessibility Page for Contact Information.

Who are we ? The creation of Volta Medical follows the discovery of a new complex medical procedure to treat atrial fibrillation (the most common cardiac arrhythmia in the world) by the company’s founders, world experts in interventional rhythmology and intracardiac signal analysis. Volta Medical is an innovative start-up based in Marseille, whose goal is to provide a range of artificial intelligence-based products to guide the cardiologist during ablation-type procedures.We started this adventure 8 years ago and our team now has more than 120 employees in France, Germany and the United States ! We completed a $27 million Series A round in November 2020 and a $36 million Series B round in January 2023.  Our values Be a pioneer: Be brave. Don’t be scared of researching, exploring, trying and sometimes failing. Improve patients’ lives: Create products to provide electrophysiologists with the best user-experience possible, to help them improve the lives of patients. Strive for excellence: Push yourselves to deliver the highest quality in everything you do. Learn from your mistakes and aim for the best. Collaborate as a team: Welcome to a multidisciplinary and a diversified team ! Try to understand people from different cultures and environments. Confront your ideas and have fun !Missions Reporting to the Director of Quality Assurance and Regulatory Affairs, the QA Validation Engineer will be responsible for ensuring compliance with all regulatory requirements throughout the entire lifecycle of computerized systems, including specifications, project, operational, and retirement phases, as well as equipment qualification and maintenance. As the Process Owner for CSV and equipment management, the engineer reviews and approves key documents such as Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), user requirements, risk analyses, validation plans, tests, changes, deviations, and more, ensuring adherence to regulations, guidelines, company policies, and standards. Key responsibilities include: Regulatory Compliance: Ensure all CSV-related regulatory requirements are fulfilled during the complete lifecycle of computerized systems. Maintain and apply up-to-date knowledge of international laws, guidelines, and new developments related to CSV. Documentation and Approval: Review and approve CSV documents to maintain compliance with regulations, guidelines, company policies, and standards. Audit and Inspection Preparation: Prepare for computer system audits and inspections. Serve as the spokesperson for CSV-related matters during audits and inspections. Perform and follow up on internal and external audits to ensure regulatory compliance. Collaboration and Support: Cooperate with engineering, IT, and other teams for the introduction of new systems and processes. Provide advice and support for CSV-related activities, ensuring cGMP aspects are considered in new projects. Participate in multi-functional teams to achieve cross-departmental objectives.Profile Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field. Minimum of 2 years of experience in Computer System Validation Strong understanding of regulatory requirements Experience developing and implementing CSV strategies and programs. Excellent communication skills, with the ability to work effectively with diverse teams Fluency in English and French.     Recruitment process Phone call with our Talent Acquisition Specialist (30’) Interview with our Senior VP Clinical, Quality & Regulatory Affairs and QARA Director (60') Case study Culture fit interview with our Global VP People and Volta ambassador (60’)What we can offer you at Volta Medical A pleasant work environment, with ideally located offices in the 6th district of Marseille offering a beautiful view upon Notre Dame de la Garde and the Mediterranean Sea. The possibility of working from home 2 days a week Passionate colleagues that have the same goal in mind: improve patients’ lives A corporate culture based on innovation, empowerment and collaboration. An international environment that allows you to practice your best american accent Prospects of ambitious evolutions with various internal mobilities Regular team building events, breakfasts, and for the people enjoying sport activities, free weekly yoga classes and preferential rates for a gym subscription. And more traditional advantages: a lunch voucher card (Swile), a good health insurance (Malakoff Humanis), a vacation bonus, RTTs in addition to paid vacation, as well as exceptional days of absence on top of those provided in the collective agreement (compensation hold in case of illness starting from 6 months of seniority, additional days for a sick child, moving leave, etc.) Join a company on a human scale, whose operations leave room for initiative and innovation in the service of patients.        €45,000 - €50,000 a year  The information that you provide is subject to personal data processing by Volta Medical as data controller for the purpose of managing your job application.  The information provided is for the use of Volta Medical’s recruitment team as well as other recipients (individuals and organizations) involved in the recruitment for the position that you applied for. Your information will be stored for the duration of the processing of your application. If you are not selected for the position, your information will not be stored, unless you consented to being included in our applicant database. In this case, your information will be stored for 2 years from the date of the submission of your application to enable us to contact you for future opportunities. Nevertheless, you have the right to withdraw your consent at any time. As part of its activities, Volta Medical may transfer data to a country outside of the European Union with appropriate safeguards in place. Volta Medical’s Privacy Policy provides more in-depth details about how your information is used and stored, as well as the legal bases that dictate the information processing that is carried out. The Privacy Policy also includes a reminder of your personal data rights and information on how to reach us with any questions or concerns.

Gorgias empowers ecommerce brands to grow through AI-powered customer experience. We are the #1 CX platform in the industry, trusted by over 15,000 merchants worldwide – from small independent shops to some of the largest ecommerce brands in the world. Here, phone systems are a vital link between customers and support services, facilitating direct voice communications and enabling efficient problem resolution. Directly support our customers with any issues related to the Voice and SMS services on a rotational basis every 4 weeks. Who You Are 6+ years of experience working as a Software Engineer 4+ years working with Python Experience working with REST APIs and web services Experience with Event Sourcing and data streaming technologies Picky about code performance and reliability Experience with high traffic Team player Nice to Have Previous experience building Voice systems Experience with Kafka, RabbitMQ, Pub/Sub, or similar technologies Knowledgeable about Kubernetes Experience with PostgreSQL and data modelling Previous SaaS experience Previous startup experience Why join us? job_name: Postdoc in far infrared detection for astrophysics H/F
job_text: Description du poste Domaine      Optique et optronique    Contrat      Post-doctorat    Intitulé de l'offre      Postdoc in far infrared detection for astrophysics H/F    Sujet de stage      The LSIS "bolometers" group, with over 20 years' international experience, developed the PACS photometer for the Herschel space observatory, based on large detector arrays in the submillimeter range. These bolometers, also used in the PILOT and ArTéMiS projects, have made a major contribution to observations of the cold universe, particularly in star-forming regions. Our current developments concern the next generation of bolometers with very high sensitivity and polarimetric capability, and are part of ESA's Voyage 2050 and NASA's Decadal Survey programs. These developments, carried out in collaboration with CEA-LETI in particular, are currently in a phase of optimizing detector performance and readout modes, with a view to their use in future projects on the ground or in space.    Durée du contrat (en mois)      24    Description de l'offre      You will be part of the LSIS laboratory, which employs around twenty people (researchers, engineers, technicians, students), and will carry out the following tasks:     In-depth analysis of detector characterization measurements, applying advanced methods and knowledge of low-temperature detection physics (light-matter interaction, superconductivity, cryogenic test methods).Active contribution to the physical models developed within the group (from the detector to the complete instrument).Broader R&D activities, particularly in the spectro-polarimetric field. Moyens / Méthodes / Logiciels      Data analysis tools (Python, Matlab) and simulation codes (Comsol).    Profil du candidat      You have a PhD in physics or instrumentation for astrophysics, you must :      have good experience of cryogenic detectors for astrophysics, acquired during a thesis or post-doctorate.      master numerical analysis tools (e.g. Python, Matlab) and simulation tools (knowledge of Comsol would be an advantage).      have excellent written and oral communication skills.      have the ability to work well in a team.     Localisation du poste Site      Saclay    Localisation du poste      France, Ile-de-France, Essonne (91)    Ville      Gif-Sur-Yvette     Critères candidat Langues      Anglais (Courant)    Diplôme préparé      Bac+8 - Doctorat scientifique    Formation recommandée      PhD in Physics, Astrophysics, Instrumentation for Astrophysics    Demandeur Disponibilité du poste      01/10/2024   Informations générales Entité de rattachement Le CEA est un acteur majeur de la recherche, au service des citoyens, de l'économie et de l'Etat.       Il apporte des solutions concrètes à leurs besoins dans quatre domaines principaux : transition énergétique, transition numérique, technologies pour la médecine du futur, défense et sécurité sur un socle de recherche fondamentale. Le CEA s'engage depuis plus de 75 ans au service de la souveraineté scientifique, technologique et industrielle de la France et de l'Europe pour un présent et un avenir mieux maîtrisés et plus sûrs.       Implanté au cœur des territoires équipés de très grandes infrastructures de recherche, le CEA dispose d'un large éventail de partenaires académiques et industriels en France, en Europe et à l'international.       Les 20 000 collaboratrices et collaborateurs du CEA partagent trois valeurs fondamentales :      La conscience des responsabilités La coopération La curiosité Référence 2024-32444     Description de l'unité      At the Institute of research into the fundamental laws of the Universe (IRFU), you will work in the Astrophysics Department (DAp-AIM) and be part of the Space Spectro-Imager Laboratory (LSIS) on the CEA Paris-Saclay site. The DAp-AIM is one of the leading space laboratories in France, Europe and the rest of the world. It employs around 200 people in research fields ranging from instrumentation to modeling and astrophysical interpretation.     The LSIS develops detectors and scientific instruments for installation in space observatories and ground-based telescopes. The laboratory has recognized expertise in the detection of high-energy (X-ray and gamma-ray) and infrared light (thermal infrared to submillimeter).

job_name: Ingénieur.e en développement logiciel et bases de données à temps partiel 60 % (H/F)
job_text: Date Limite Candidature : vendredi 26 juillet 2024 23:59:00 heure de Paris    Assurez-vous que votre profil candidat soit correctement renseigné avant de postuler Informations générales Intitulé de l'offre : Ingénieur.e en développement logiciel et bases de données à temps partiel 60 % (H/F)  Référence : FR3747-PAUPET-009 Nombre de Postes : 1 Lieu de travail : LYON 07 Date de publication : vendredi 5 juillet 2024 Type de contrat : CDD Technique/Administratif Durée du contrat : 11 mois Date d'embauche prévue : 1 octobre 2024 Quotité de travail : Temps incomplet Rémunération : à partir de 1 423 € brut mensuel selon expérience Niveau d'études souhaité : Niveau 6 - (Bac+3 ou 4) Expérience souhaitée : 1 à 4 années BAP : Informatique, Statistiques et Calcul scientifique Emploi type : Ingénieur-e en ingénierie logicielle Missions Vous exercerez vos missions dans le cadre du projet SIAMOIS (Système d’Information Archéologique Mutualisé et Ouvert reposant sur l’Intelligence Sémantique) qui s’inscrit dans la thématique de la numérisation du patrimoine et de l’architecture. La mission consiste en la création d'un logiciel répondant aux besoins de la communauté archéologique via l’élaboration d’un système d’enregistrement, de gestion et de partage des données des fouilles interopérable. Vous interviendrez sur le développement de l’application SIA (Système d’Information Archéologique) avec les briques suivantes : création de la base de données, du code métier et de l’interface web. Le logiciel est à développer en open source et doit intégrer nativement les liens avec des vocabulaires contrôlés et des graphes. Activités       En tant qu’ingénieur.e en développement logiciel et bases de données, vous serez en charge de :       la création du modèle de données en lien avec le porteur et les partenaires du projetla conception et la création de la base de donnéesles simulations et le test des performancesle développement du cœur du programme en javale développement de l’interface Web en lien avec le programme métier javala conception d’une interface adaptative pour tout type de terminalla collaboration régulière avec les partenaires du projet pour assurer le suivila rédaction de la documentation technique Compétences       Pour assurer ces missions, vous devrez avoir de solides connaissances et compétences en :      Bases de données relationnelles sous PostgresqlProgrammation java, javascript, JSF et SpringBootThésaurus et vocabulaires contrôlés Vous devrez également avoir des bases de connaissance en :      LinuxBases de données graphesOutils de développement collaboratif (git) Contexte de travail L’agent.e sera affecté.e à la plateforme technologique Web sémantique et Thesauri du pôle système d'information et réseaux de la Maison de l’Orient et de la Méditerranée Jean Pouilloux (MOM). Située à Lyon, la MOM est une unité de recherche qui compte 31 agents permanents et contractuels. Elle fédère quatre laboratoires autour d'une identité scientifique commune, l'étude des sociétés anciennes, de la Préhistoire au monde médiéval, principalement au Proche et Moyen Orient et sur le pourtour méditerranéen ainsi que sur le territoire métropolitain. Elle soutient le développement de projets ainsi que le développement d’outils et de ressources à destination de la communauté scientifique. Elle gère des moyens communs à travers six services d’appui à la recherche (administration et pilotage, archives, bibliothèque, éditions, pôle système d'information et réseaux, techniques archéologiques). La MOM (la fédération et les quatre laboratoires) compte environ 250 membres (chercheurs, enseignants-chercheurs, ITA/ITRF, doctorants…).  Le pôle système d’information et réseaux (PSIR) est un service informatique qui développe des applications open source destinées à la communauté scientifique. Vous exercerez votre activité sous la responsabilité du responsable de la plateforme.  Des déplacements en France sont à prévoir : réunions de travail avec les partenaires du projet (Bibracte, services territoriaux d’archéologie, Inrap, unités CNRS…).  Pour plus d’informations sur le poste, veuillez contacter Miled Rousset, responsable de la plateforme : miled.rousset@mom.fr Informations complémentairesUn environnement de travail stimulant au contact des personnels de la rechercheLe remboursement partiel des titres de transport est possible sous certaines conditions (plafond règlementaire) + forfait mobilité durableUn site accessible en transports en communParticipation financière aux frais de mutuelleAccès au Comité d'Action Économique et Sociale du CNRS à partir de 6 mois d'anciennetéLe CNRS s'engage pour l'égalité professionnelle à travers un réseau de correspondants et correspondantes égalité

Job Title Senior QA Engineer - Shopping Orchestration  Summary of the role: If you’re thinking about your next career move and seeking fresh opportunities in the field of Quality Assurance (QA), this post is for you! At the core of our industry lie Finding and Pricing travel options. In today’s fiercely competitive business landscape, the battleground for innovation in travel revolves around search and pricing. For Amadeus, achieving excellence and driving continuous innovation is not just a goal—it’s a necessity for success. If you’re passionate about maintaining excellence, ensuring compliance, and driving continuous improvement, then this role is tailor-made for you! Let me introduce you to the Shopping Intelligence and Orchestrator (SIO) department. We’re currently recruiting in Nice for the position of Senior QA Engineer. In this role you'll: Understanding the SSP Ecosystem: Dive deep into the architecture and challenges of the Search, Shopping, and Pricing (SSP) ecosystem. Explore both functional and technical aspects, with a specific focus on Shopping Orchestration. Functional and Technical Leadership: As a functional and technical lead, you’ll define and propagate best practices related to QA methodology across the organisation. Your expertise will guide the team toward excellence. Scrum Team Collaboration: Join a dynamic scrum team that handles QA activities for backend-oriented features. These features include virtual Interlining, solution based on Machine Learning, and new content integration within Amadeus Travel Agency Rest API services. QA Transformation: Over the coming years, you’ll actively contribute to the implementation of QA transformation at the SIO level. The goal? To achieve fast and high-quality deliveries for our valued customers. If you’re ready to make an impact and be part of an exciting journey, consider joining us in the SIO Department. Your expertise will shape the future of travel technology! Has working experience and advanced and specialized technical/functional knowledge in own discipline. Understands how own area contributes to the business. Acts as a reference for colleagues with less experience and supports junior team members. Influences decisions related to own activity, anticipating dependencies and consequences in complex scenarios, contributes to transversal projects, proposes improvements to processes and is accountable for own and team commitments. Works independently within plan dictated by manager, with some guidance on most complex situations.  Specific accountabilities:   Test strategy  Attend to specification/architecture reviews (also on customer specification reviews when applicable), and provide feedback along with any potential impact, risk, issue or missed gap based on experienceDefine test strategy and test plan containing test cases (functional and non-functional), ensure traceability with specifications and customer requirementsEnsure compliance of test strategy with CI/CD guidelines, Green IT guidelines and all quality guidelines (SDL, STDL), QA best practices/standards from the industry (ISTQB..) Test expertise  Design test cases and write test case scriptsPrepare test environment, test data, and execute test casesProvide sign-off (go/no-go) on tested features based on defined exit criteriaContinuously assess the need to add/update/remove test cases to existing regression and CI/CD pipeline when new product features are delivered and based on metrics (stabilization, deletion of flaky tests...)As part of maintenance activities, investigate PTRs, test the fixes, and enrich test suites accordingly Test automation  Assess necessity to automate subset of (or all) test scriptsUse test automation framework and contribute to its improvement Defect management  Open defects for software or documentation, assign relevant level of severity based on the importance of the issue, provide relevant investigation and information in order to fix defectsCheck defect fix, and give go/no-go for the load of production defects Reporting  Report and communicate on test activities to the line organization, software developers and product definitions analystsProvide visibility on testing campaign/milestones to all stakeholders Support  Provide mentoring and adapted support to newcomersProvide adapted support to QAE peers based on experience Knowledge sharing  Share knowledge on a specific topic (technical/functional) and spread it among the QA community as well as other stakeholders Quality assurance ambassador  Show accountability for the project, product or release quality controlPropagate quality assurance best practices based on highest standards in relevant teams and quality communities Technicity  Efficiently use QA tooling stack and frameworksBe a force of proposition for improvement of existing ones, or development of new onesBe proactive about any issue/change that is likely to affect QA peers daily job Continuous and sustainable improvement  Be a driving force behind proposals to improve current quality processes in a constantly evolving development lifecycle framework (SAFE...)Act as a pioneer and be part of implementation teams/workshops/taskforces for newest used tools/frameworks/technologiesParticipate to the understanding, measurement and reduction of the environmental impact of the tested applications and associated QA activities About our ideal candidate Experience with Test Management Tools A knowledge of different programming languages, such as Java, Python (preferred), and scripting languages, such as SQL, Edifact to write and execute test cases, scripts, and scenarios University degree in Computer science ISTQB Certification Advanced knowledge of Gitlab A solid understanding of software development methodologies, such as agile, Waterfall, Scrum, or Kanban, and the role of QA in each phase A proficiency in various testing tools, frameworks, and techniques, such as manual testing, automated testing, unit testing, integration testing, system testing, regression testing, functional testing, non-functional testing, user acceptance testing, etc Fluent English What will be considered as a great advantage: ISTQB Test Manager Travel industry experience A curiosity to learn new technologies, tools, and trends in the QA field, and to update and upgrade their skills and knowledge accordingly Working at Amadeus, you will find A critical mission and purpose - At Amadeus, you will be powering the future of travel and pursuing a critical mission and extraordinary purpose. A truly global DNA - Everything at Amadeus is global, from our people to our business, which translates into our footprint, processes, and culture. Great opportunities to learn - Learning happens all the time and in many ways at Amadeus, through on-the-job training, formal learning activities, and day-to-day interactions with colleagues. A caring environment - Amadeus fosters a caring environment, nurturing both a fulfilling career and personal and family life. We care about our employees and strive to provide a supportive work environment. A complete rewards offer - Amadeus provides attractive remuneration packages, covering all essential components of a competitive reward offer, including salary, bonus, equity, and benefits. A flexible working model - We want our employees to do their best work, wherever and however it works best for them. A diverse and inclusive community - We are committed to leveraging our uniquely diverse population to drive innovation, creativity, and collaboration across our organization. A Reliable Company - Trust and reliability are fundamental values that drive our actions and shape long-lasting relationships with our customers, partners, and employees. #LI-EMEA Diversity & Inclusion Amadeus aspires to be a leader in Diversity, Equity and Inclusion in the tech industry, enabling every employee to reach their full potential by fostering a culture of belonging and fair treatment, attracting the best talent from all backgrounds, and as a role model for an inclusive employee experience. Amadeus is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender, race, ethnicity, sexual orientation, age, beliefs, disability or any other characteristics protected by law.

Gorgias empowers ecommerce brands to grow through AI-powered customer experience. We are the #1 CX platform in the industry, trusted by over 15,000 merchants worldwide – from small independent shops to some of the largest ecommerce brands in the world. We offer the most integrations of any tool on Shopify (100+) and the ability to get setup fast, without the need for complex onboarding. Gorgias offers its users a unified platform to manage every aspect of their customer support on every channel. We can automate 60% of a brand’s support so that agents can focus on high-value conversations and driving sales. Plus, we offer purpose-built marketing tools to help merchants convert more shoppers into customers, driving GMV. The position is available across our European hubs, including Paris (France), Lisbon (Portugal), and Belgrade (Serbia). Our work arrangement is hybrid, with a requirement of two days per week in the office. About the Apps Team The Apps Team is responsible for creating and maintaining Native Apps between external services and Gorgias, as well as enabling others to create apps in Gorgias. Apps are the connecting piece between Gorgias and the rest of the ecosystem: through them, support tickets are created and answered, customer data is ingested, actions on external services are executed. There are two main types of apps: Messaging apps: apps which allow users to send and receive messages from third-party channels. Those include for example Gmail, Facebook Messenger, or Aircall. Ecommerce apps: apps which allow users to have more data about customers contacting them and to execute actions for those customers. Those include for example Shopify, Recharge, or Magento 2. What You'll Do This position is for the Apps Native team. Your mission will be to: Develop new APIs and maintain existing ones, to integrate Gorgias with third-party services and allow other companies to easily do the same Maintain and extend the Email features and integrations of Gorgias Maintain existing Social and Ecommerce Apps Develop new features for existing and new Apps Work closely with Teams in charge of the other Gorgias products (Phone, Automate, Convert) to help them integrate their features into Gorgias Apps Support our customers directly with issues on the Team’s domain once every 6 weeks Who You Are 5+ years of experience working as a Software Engineer 4+ years working with Node.js / Python 4+ years working with REST APIs and web services Experience with Event Sourcing and data streaming technologies Picky about code performance and reliability Experience with high traffic and scaling relational databases Team player Nice to Have 5+ years working with React / Flask / Celery Experience with Kafka, RabbitMQ, Pub/Sub, or similar technologies Knowledgeable about Kubernetes Experience with PostgreSQL and data modeling Previous SaaS experience Previous startup experience Company Benefits and Perks (for France) 5-week vacation plus 2 weeks RTT (We follow each country's appropriate PTO Laws) Paid sick leave Paid parental leave (16 weeks) MacBook Pro Personal credit card to buy lunches (we use Swile) We provide private health insurance (we use Alan) Get up to €700 to set up your workstation at home (working from home should feel breezy) Get up to €2000 of learning material and wellness support per year! This includes €1500 for learning material (such as books, courses, and individual coaching sessions) directly linked to your job scope, as well as a €500 wellness budget. Take advantage of these resources to grow in your role and prioritize your personal development and wellness. Every quarter, we organize an online company-wide summit to discuss where we’re going and strengthen social bonds. Once per year we organize offsite team retreats and company retreats! (Here is the photo album from our last company retreat in Mexico in 2022, when we were a total of 200 people! & the video of the September 2023 P&E team retreat in Romania) Join our team for the opportunity to: Work with smart, passionate people every day Get extreme ownership over your work and results Be treated like the expert you are Engineering Team Culture Getting Stuff Done, Ownership, Team Work, Excellence, and Agility. job_name: Développeur Full Stack IA Solutions (H/F) - CDI
job_text: A propos du posteLa DSI du Groupe Rossel La Voix part en quête de son futur talent afin de la rejoindre ! Vous recherchez un nouveau challenge professionnel au sein d’un environnement stimulant vous permettant d’évoluer sur des missions diversifiées ? Cette annonce est peut-être faite pour vous ! Le département Rossel Applications a pour mission la supervision et la prise en charge de l’ensemble des tâches de conception, de mise en oeuvre, d’intégration et d’évolution des différents environnements applicatifs du Groupe Rossel (digital, publicité, contenu éditorial, marketing, finance, RH, support client, gestion d’abonnements, vente et distribution, ...). Vos missions - Vous travaillez avec les équipes de développement et les chefs de produit en vue de créer des solutions logicielles, - Vous travaillez également avec des Data Engineer, Architect et Scientist en vue de mettre en oeuvre de manière efficiente et optimiser des solutions d'IA générative, - Vous participez aux projets d’innovations sur nos applications en ajoutant des fonctionnalités d’IA génératives et les pratiques MLOps/LLMOps, - Vous concevez une architecture côté client et côté serveur, - Vous développez des applications front-end via une conception visuelle attrayante, - Vous développez et gérez des bases de données et des applications fonctionnelles, - Vous rédigez des API efficaces, - Vous réalisez des tests de logiciels afin de garantir leur réactivité et leur efficacité, - Vous réalisez la maintenance et la mise à niveau des logiciels, - Vous créez des réglages de sécurité et de protection des données, - Vous développez des fonctionnalités et des applications avec une conception mobile réactive, - Vous rédigez la documentation technique (avec l’aide de l’IA). A propos du profil recherchéDiplômé d’une formation en informatique, vous justifiez d’une expérience significative en tant que Développeur Full Stack ou Expert IA. Vous maitrisez plusieurs bibliothèques de langages de premier plan (ex : HTML, CSS, JavaScript, XML, jQuery) ainsi que les langages de back-end (ex : C#, Java, Python) et les structures JavaScript (ex : Angular, React, Node.js). Vous faites preuve d’une bonne connaissance des bases de données (ex : MySQL, MongoDB), des serveurs web et conception UI/UX. Vous appréciez travailler en équipe, vous avez un sens prononcé du détail et vous êtes reconnu pour votre esprit analytique. CDI, statut cadre A pourvoir dès que possible Avantages : RTT, télétravail, rémunération sur 13,5 mois, avantages CSE, titres restaurants... A propos de l'entrepriseLe Groupe Rossel La Voix est un groupe multimédia qui s'étend sur l'ensemble de la région Haut-de-France, une partie du Grand-Est, de la Normandie et de la Savoie Composés d'une quarantaine de marques différentes réparties entre le secteur de la presse, de la publicité, de l'imprimerie et de l'audiovisuel, nous sommes ancrés localement dans nos territoires. Parmi nos marques les plus connues on retrouve notamment La Voix du Nord, L'Union, Courrier Picard, Paris Normandie, Wéo et Radio Contact. Grâce à la multiplicité de nos activités, nous bénéficions d'un grand panel de métiers au sein de notre Groupe. Journalistes, commerciaux, experts du marketing et du digital, informaticiens et fonctions supports oeuvrent au quotidien pour le fonctionnement de nos entreprises. Depuis 2005, le Groupe Rossel La Voix n'a eu de cesse de s'agrandir et de développer son expertise grâce à ses 1600 collaborateurs afin de répondre au mieux aux attentes de nos lecteurs et de nos annonceurs.

Gorgias empowers ecommerce brands to grow through AI-powered customer experience. We are the #1 CX platform in the industry, trusted by over 15,000 merchants worldwide – from small independent shops to some of the largest ecommerce brands in the world. We offer the most integrations of any tool on Shopify (100+) and the ability to get setup fast, without the need for complex onboarding. Gorgias offers its users a unified platform to manage every aspect of their customer support on every channel. We can automate 60% of a brand’s support so that agents can focus on high-value conversations and driving sales. Plus, we offer purpose-built marketing tools to help merchants convert more shoppers into customers, driving GMV. The position is available across our European hubs, including Paris (France), Lisbon (Portugal), and Belgrade (Serbia). Our work arrangement is hybrid, with a requirement of two days per week in the office. About the Apps Team The Apps Team is responsible for creating and maintaining Native Apps between external services and Gorgias, as well as enabling others to create apps in Gorgias. Apps are the connecting piece between Gorgias and the rest of the ecosystem: through them, support tickets are created and answered, customer data is ingested, actions on external services are executed. There are two main types of apps: Messaging apps: apps which allow users to send and receive messages from third-party channels. Those include for example Gmail, Facebook Messenger, or Aircall. Ecommerce apps: apps which allow users to have more data about customers contacting them and to execute actions for those customers. Those include for example Shopify, Recharge, or Magento 2. What You'll Do This position is for the Apps Native team. Your mission will be to: Develop new APIs and maintain existing ones, to integrate Gorgias with third-party services and allow other companies to easily do the same Maintain and extend the Email features and integrations of Gorgias Maintain existing Social and Ecommerce Apps Develop new features for existing and new Apps Work closely with Teams in charge of the other Gorgias products (Phone, Automate, Convert) to help them integrate their features into Gorgias Apps Support our customers directly with issues on the Team’s domain once every 6 weeks Who You Are 5+ years of experience working as a Software Engineer 4+ years working with Node.js / Python 4+ years working with REST APIs and web services Experience with Event Sourcing and data streaming technologies Picky about code performance and reliability Experience with high traffic and scaling relational databases Team player Nice to Have 5+ years working with React / Flask / Celery Experience with Kafka, RabbitMQ, Pub/Sub, or similar technologies Knowledgeable about Kubernetes Experience with PostgreSQL and data modeling Previous SaaS experience Previous startup experience Company Benefits and Perks (for France) 5-week vacation plus 2 weeks RTT (We follow each country's appropriate PTO Laws) Paid sick leave Paid parental leave (16 weeks) MacBook Pro Personal credit card to buy lunches (we use Swile) We provide private health insurance (we use Alan) Get up to €700 to set up your workstation at home (working from home should feel breezy) Get up to €2000 of learning material and wellness support per year! This includes €1500 for learning material (such as books, courses, and individual coaching sessions) directly linked to your job scope, as well as a €500 wellness budget. Take advantage of these resources to grow in your role and prioritize your personal development and wellness. Every quarter, we organize an online company-wide summit to discuss where we’re going and strengthen social bonds. Once per year we organize offsite team retreats and company retreats! (Here is the photo album from our last company retreat in Mexico in 2022, when we were a total of 200 people! & the video of the September 2023 P&E team retreat in Romania) Join our team for the opportunity to: Work with smart, passionate people every day Get extreme ownership over your work and results Be treated like the expert you are Engineering Team Culture Getting Stuff Done, Ownership, Team Work, Excellence, and Agility. You should join us if you want to ship stuff fast without sacrificing quality. We've put great importance on testing our code, cleaning it, treating errors first, and features later. We also value growth and ownership. People make mistakes. We learn from them to avoid them in the future. We cannot achieve excellence if there are no bumps in the road. Why join us? We're among the fastest-growing startups in the eCommerce ecosystem We've built an extremely efficient go-to-market engine Work with a talented team you'll learn a lot from Join a company where automation and good & clean data are core beliefs shared by all Here is an interview with one of our team member’s experiences from our most recent company retreat to Cancun! More cool things to know about Gorgias... Accordingly, if reasonable accommodation is required to fully participate in the job application or interview process, to perform the essential functions of the position, and/or to receive all other benefits and privileges of employment, please contact accommodation@gorgias.com

Composé d’une cinquantaine de collaborateurs, la DSI du Groupe SNEF développe et déploie des solutions innovantes, adaptées aux différents besoins et activités des services, agences et entités SNEF.   VOS MISSIONS   Vous travaillez conjointement avec les équipes de développement et apportez votre expertise et votre support sur l’ensemble du cycle de vie de développement des bases de données transactionnelles et décisionnelles.   Conception de bases de données  Effectuer les choix d’implémentation des bases de données dans le respect du cahier des charges et en collaboration avec les différents acteurs du projet (chef de projet, architectes, consultants ERP, experts « décisionnelle » ...)Concevoir, réaliser et optimiser l’architecture de la donnée de notre système d’information opérationnelParticiper à la conception et au développement de l’architecture de l’entrepôt de données décisionnel Maintenir la documentation des schémas relationnels et non relationnels Proposer et suivre les optimisations des requêtes SQL et no SQL afin de garantir les meilleures performances de nos applications métierAssurer le support aux équipes de développement afin d’identifier et proposer des solutions performantes Gestion de la donnée  Concevoir, développer et maintenir les flux de synchronisation entre nos différents systèmes avec notre outil ETLDéfinir les templates, concevoir et réaliser les opérations d’import de données en masse Support technique, assistance et observabilité   Participer aux corrections d’incidents, demandes d’évolutions des chefs de projet métier et assurer l’assistance utilisateurs de niveau 3Participer au déploiement de l’architecture applicative de microservices en adaptant le modèle de données historiqueSuivre et gérer les performances des Bases Oracle et mongoDBAssurer la veille technologique et traiter l’obsolescence technique VOTRE PROFIL   Diplôme de type Bac+3 et plus (grandes écoles ou université)Expérience de 5 ans minimum sur un poste similaireBonnes connaissances SQL et PL SQLBonnes connaissances Oracle, MongoDb serait un plus.Bonnes connaissances de l’ETL Talend.Connaissance d’outils de Reporting (ex : Jasper Studio, PowerBI ...)Connaissance d’un outil de modélisation de bases de données (ex : Power AMC)Connaissance de la Méthodologie Agile (Gitlab) Esprit d'équipe, réactivité, facilité d’adaptation et rigueur sont des atouts indispensables pour réussir à cette fonction.   Rejoindre la DSI SNEF, c'est intégrer une équipe dynamique et innovante qui intervient sur des projets passionnants avec son propre ERP et des technologies variées.    Langues nécessaires :    Français    Région :    Bouches-du-Rhône Intitulé :   ingénieur base de données (H/F)   Référence :    24.035.00EI   Type de contrat :    CDI    Formation :    Bac +3   Expérience :    6 - 10 ans   Date de création :    2024-07-05   Secteur :    Mobilité :    Non   Site :    MARSEILLE   Métier :
