Diabolocom enables organizations worldwide to build brand loyalty and drive sales growth. Our innovative cloud-based solution leverages its proprietary AI technologies to optimize contact centers of medium to large sizes, enabling efficient management of customer interactions across all communication channels. As a telecom operator, we ensure premium voice quality, efficient handling of high call volumes, and provide phone numbers worldwide.  Our comprehensive range of AI services, specifically designed for customer relations, elevates data quality and automates tasks. These services, fully integrated into our cloud contact center solutions, are also accessible through APIs in multiple languages.  We empower Customer Service and Sales teams to effectively handle all inbound and outbound interactions thanks to our state-of-the-art dialer. Our solution seamlessly integrateswith leading CRMs and offers real-time monitoring and analytics capabilities.  Diabolocom, with offices across Europe, the USA, Brazil, and the UAE, proudly serves 350+ clients, with agents operating from 60+ countries.  About the Role: Diabolocom is seeking a skilled and experienced Software Engineer (Golang) to join its Software Engineering team. This role is crucial for developing new backend services and enhancing customer communication channels, including chats, SMS, WhatsApp, and    support for email services.  Your Responsibilities: Develop microservices and adapters for specific written channels (chats, SMS,   WhatsApp).    -Collaborate with backend/frontend developers and product owners to deliver high-    quality solutions. Mentor team members in GoLang best practices to facilitate skill development within   the team.  What We're Looking For: Minimum 5 years of experience in backend development.Strong proficiency in GoLang with at least 3 years of hands-on experience.Experience with microservice architecture and API design.Knowledge of cloud-native infrastructure and CI/CD tools is a plus.Fluent in English, both written and spoken. What's in it for You: Work in a multicultural environment with colleagues from 5 different countries and 10 nationalities. First choice IT equipment and a central office location in Paris near the Opera Garnier.Remote-friendly work environment.Swile card for lunch vouchers.Team building events in exciting locations like Ibiza, Porquerolles, and Corsica.Opportunity to contribute to a growing company with ample career development   prospects. A culture where your ideas are valued and contribute directly to the organization's   success. Continuous learning and growth opportunities. Recruitment Process: Technical challenge on HackerRank platform to assess general levelCall with a Talent Acquisition ManagerLive coding challenge and design interview through screen sharing with our Lead Software EngineerCall with David, our COO

Who We Are:Zendar is creating a high-resolution radar imaging system that has resolution similar to lidar, allowing cars to see the driving world in all conditions and at long distances to travel at high speeds. We want to change the role of radar in the Advanced driving assist (ADAS) sensor stack and demonstrate that radars can take on many of the functions of lidar at a much lower cost. Zendar has pioneered a software-defined radar technology which fuses data streams from multiple sensors to build a more accurate scene and utilizes machine learning to understand the environment. All of this works in an embedded AI processor with tight latency and performance guarantees to deliver reliable sensing and perception.Zendar was founded in the San Francisco Bay area, at the very heart of one of the most advanced regions in the development of advanced vehicles technologies. We also have offices in Wangen (Baden-Württemberg, Germany) and Paris (France).Zendar has a diverse and dynamic team of electrical, mechanical, RF, algorithms and software engineers with a deep background in sensing technology. Zendar is backed by Tier-1 VCs, has raised more than $50M in funding and has established strong partnerships with industry leaders. Our team has more than doubled in number over the last year as our technology has gained traction in the automotive and agriculture industries.Who You Are:In this role, you will be responsible for building and fine tuning our software platform components that our algorithms run on. In this role, you will interact closely with the algorithms and applications teams to define the Software interface between platform Software and the rest of the stack. You will also be responsible for working closely with other engineering teams to analyze the performance of the Software stack and to improve all areas of the codebase.What We Look For:Proficiency with modern C++ (we use C++ 14) and python Experience programming multiprocess/multithreaded applications in production environment Experience profiling and analyzing the performance of C++/python applications Experience developing for embedded Linux or POSIX systems Familiarity with CUDA/OpenCL Familiarity with professional software development tools, such as source control (git), unit testing, and profiling Strong communication and cross-functional collaboration skillsBonus Points:Experience with developing mission critical software (e.g. aviation or autonomous vehicles) Experience developing software that runs on an RTOS Experience with radar, lidar, cameras, GPS/IMU, or other automotive sensors Experience mentoring team members on software development and best practicesWhat We Have To Offer:Opportunity to make an impact at a young, venture-backed company in an emerging market Competitive salary and benefits Hybrid work model: in office 3 days per week, the rest… work from wherever! A working place in the center of Paris (10)Please submit your CV in English!Zendar is committed to creating a diverse environment where talented people come to do their best work. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

Created in 2016, Meero is the world expert in image quality, providing the best end-to-end visual content solutions for online sellers. From fashion professional photography to AI-based image management and quality enhancement, we’re here to analyze, optimize and beautify all visuals in order to boost online sales. At the crossroads of AI and creativity, Meero partners with players in diverse industries (Real Estate, Automotive, Fashion...) all around the world. www.meero.com / www.autoretouch.com Position Overview Location: Paris (France) We are seeking a dynamic and innovative Engineering Manager to join our Fashion team at Meero, focusing on our AutoRetouch product line. As part of a 10-person startup-like team within Meero, you will play a crucial role in revolutionizing the production and editing of images for e-commerce through cutting-edge AI technologies. About the Team and Products Our Fashion team is dedicated to developing AutoRetouch, an advanced suite of AI-driven tools designed to transform image production and editing for large brands and marketplaces in the B2B e-commerce space. The core challenge is to develop and deploy AI algorithms at scale, capable of processing tens of millions of images annually. AutoRetouch consists of two main products: AI Image Enhancement: Automates the retouching process of pre-captured photos using advanced image segmentation and generative AI techniques, such as shadow creation. This product is already in the market and serving multiple clients, streamlining their image production workflows. AI Image Generation: Focuses on generating high-quality images that showcase real clothes on AI-generated models. This product is currently in the pre-product-market fit stage, with significant potential and for innovation and development. This is a unique opportunity to lead a talented team, drive technological innovation, and make a significant impact in the fashion e-commerce industry. Key Responsibilities Team Leadership: Manage and mentor a team of engineers (Computer Vision, Data, Fullstack), fostering top-tier performance and a collaborative, innovative work environment. Tech Vision: Direct our AI endeavors to ensure they remain at the cutting edge of technology. Oversee the development of two products: one mature product and another pre-market fit product focused on generative AI. Technical Strategy: Define and drive the technical strategy, ensuring alignment with business goals while leveraging the latest advancements in AI and machine learning. Hands-on Contribution: Maintain a hands-on approach in coding and problem-solving, providing technical guidance and best practices to support the team. Cross-functional Collaboration: Work closely with other departments, including product management, translating tech potentials into impactful, market-ready offerings. Quality Guardian: Establish and uphold quality control measures, guaranteeing the reliability and precision of our tech outputs. Performance Management: Set clear performance objectives, conduct regular performance reviews, and support professional development within the team. Qualifications/Skills At least 7 years in software engineering, with a strong background in computer vision. Advanced degrees (Ph.D. or Master's) in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Computer Vision, or related fields are highly preferred. Hands-on experience in building, implementing and deploying cutting-edge machine learning and AI models on industry settings. Strong experience in Python and Pytorch. Familiar with DevOps principles: CI/CD, Cloud technologies, and Docker. Over 3 years of successfully managing high-performing, diverse software engineering teams (ML, Front-end, Back-end). Capable of seamlessly switching between hands-on execution and providing strategic advice, adapting to the needs of the situation. Ability to communicate complex technical concepts to both technical and business stakeholders and demonstrated success in developing and executing AI strategies that align with business objectives. Thrive in a fast paced environment, driving your team to excel by viewing changes as opportunities to add structure and order where needed. Strong entrepreneurial mindset with the ability to drive projects involving complex technical challenges and take full responsibility for problems, ensuring end-to-end solutions. Strong English and French communication skills, both written and verbal. Hiring process:  A first call with a member of our Talent Acquisition Team A second Interview to discuss technical expertise and give you more details about the position and the team. Technical Test, live coding session to assess your real-time coding skills and approach to problem-solving. Final Interview, On-site meeting (Paris Office) with the CTO, CEO and team members to discuss your fit within the team and company culture. Background Check 6+ years

SYXPERIANE est une ESN pas comme les autres. Nous avons développé une culture et un état d'esprit fédérateurs. Nous sommes en plein dans la mouvance RSE assez en vogue mais chez nous, ce n'est pas du fake. On travaille le fond et cela produit des résultats : l'ambiance est bonne, le baromètre social bat des records d'adhésion. Nous sommes actuellement un peu plus de 200 collaborateurs répartis sur 9 sites et nous conservons un état d'esprit très familial. Nos métiers : l'intégration d'ERP (nous sommes 1er intégrateur Cegid XRP Ultimate, 1er intégrateur Divalto), l'intégration d'outils Paye et SIRH, la mise en oeuvre de solutions BI et data management, l'hébergement de solutions, la gestion et la maintenance de l'IT. Description du poste Notre équipe BI est composée de cinq collaborateurs et collaboratrices dynamiques dans laquelle l’entraide et la qualité de services sont les maîtres mots. Les consultants sont répartis sur nos agences de Villeneuve d’Ascq et Bègles. Dans le cadre de notre croissance, nous recrutons un.e Consultant/Consultante technique BI. Nous travaillons étroitement avec l’ensemble des BU de la société, afin de nous adapter aux besoins de nos clients. En tant que consultant ou consultante technique BI, vous serez amené à :Participer à la R&D en concevant et implémentant de nouvelles modélisations sur les ERP intégrés dans le groupe (Divalto, XRP)Extraire et structurer les donnéesCréer et/ou optimiser les vues SQLAnalyser les besoins des clients avec les équipes métiersConcevoir, développer et garantir la qualité des traitements de donnéesAccompagner nos clients dans la réalisation des DashboardsAssurer la mise en œuvre, le suivi et la mise à jour des outils déployésÊtre garant des bonnes pratiquesFormer des utilisateurs et animez des ateliersParticiper à la veille technologique concurrentielle pour se positionner éventuellement sur de nouvelles technologiesÊtre force de proposition Profil recherché Vous êtes actuellement dans une formation BAC +4/+5 de Data Engineer/Data Scientist et vous recherchez une alternance pour la rentrée de septembre 2024 d'un ou deux ans. Vous disposez également d'un état d'esprit positif et avez pour volonté de faire un bon travail dans une bonne ambiance. Nous cherchons à nous engager dans la durée avec nos futurs collaborateurs et collaboratrices. Nous portons donc une attention particulière à l'intégration et au développement de leurs compétences. Vous serez positionné sur des missions appropriées à vos compétences, immergé au sein d’une équipe où tout le monde est simple et sympa. Quelques avantages : Carte titre restaurant (Swile) à 9 € par jour travaillé De l'intéressement réparti de manière égalitaire entre tous les collaborateurs Un CSE impliqué et dynamique Une association ZINK qui organise des activités de cohésion d'équipe plusieurs fois par an Un séminaire une fois par an avec beaucoup de moments de convivialité Un environnement de travail où les maîtres mots sont "simple et sympa"

L'entreprise est une start’up de la « FemTech » qui allie créativité et technologie de pointe pour enfin offrir aux femmes les produits qu’elles méritent. Depuis le lancement de sa sonde périnéale en 2018, l’entreprise a connu une croissance exemplaire, tout en restant profitable. Nous avons multiplié notre chiffre d’affaires par 100 depuis 2018 ! Il est temps de briser les tabous autour des fuites urinaires, de la fertilité, de l’allaitement, trop longtemps ignorés pour offrir aux femmes de vraies solutions, adaptées et efficaces. Aujourd’hui notre premier produit distribué désormais dans tous les pays du monde, une sonde de rééducation périnéale, est considéré comme la sonde de renforcement périnéal la plus efficace, la mieux notée et la plus vendue sur le marché. Il a soigné déjà plus de 250 000 femmes. Plus de 90% de nos clientes recommandent l'entreprise et nous avons déjà créé une véritable communauté autour de nos produits! Notre deuxième produit, un tire lait portable, suit une trajectoire similaire. Notre équipe est passée de 2 cofondateurs à plus d’une trentaine de collaborateurs (50% H/F) en trois ans, dans l’esprit d’une entreprise libérée, basée sur l’autonomie, la confiance, et la cohésion. Chez l'entreprise, tout est fait pour vous faire adorer votre travail. Vous changez la vie de milliers de femmes chaque jour, au cœur de l’industrie innovante de la Femtech! Nos valeurs chez l'entreprise (et nous en sommes fiers !) : FREEDOM – FEMINISM – STARTUP MINDSET – REAL IMPACT – NO EGO Descriptif du poste: We’re looking for our new Product Manager for our latest product, a connected wearable breast pump. Your role is to oversee the product and its development to make it the best possible product for our users. Your missions Understand the market and customer needs. Build strong relationships with our users by spending time interviewing them and engaging with them for feedback. Conduct user research to gather and analyze both quantitative and qualitative data. Uncover pain points and identify areas for improvement. With those insights and the company’s objectives in mind, define your OKRs and roadmap, including both software and hardware developments. Prioritize actions to have the strongest and fastest possible impact on the NPS, our key metric. Oversee software development sprints and work hand-in-hand with design, development, and QA teams to ensure smooth delivery and create an amazing product experience. Also collaborate with hardware engineers to iterate on the product. We love the lean approach for faster and more relevant iterations. Get your hands into our data platform to gather insights on what needs to be solved. Monitor app performance closely. Measure impact through A/B tests and make data-driven decisions to iterate and improve the product. Collaborate with other teams, gather insights, embark people with you, and communicate product plans and results to all stakeholders. Profil recherché : Proven experience as a Product Manager in a tech startup or scale-up, with a minimum of 6 years of experience Customer-first mindset. You put the user at the center of all your thoughts. Strong organizational & project management skills. Problem-solving mindset. You are proficient in analytics and tracking tools (such as mixpanel). You have a strong understanding of both software and hardware development processes or are a fast learner. Technical knowledge would be a plus. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills. Able to multitask, prioritize, and manage time effectively You speak and write excellent English and French You are a feminist and believe in the right of every woman to have access to effective health solutions. You are comfortable talking about women’s health issues, are not intimidated by the topics of breastfeeding and female intimacy in general, and curious to learn more.

\uD83D\uDC6B About the team At Equativ, we’re on a mission to develop advertising technologies that empower our customers to reach their digital business goals. This means that we rely on massively scalable, widely distributed, highly available, and efficient software systems; the platform deals with over 3 millions requests per second managed by 3,000 servers.   Our innovation team based in Paris, Nantes, Limoges, Krakow and Berlin is composed of 100+ straightforward and energetic engineers working in an Agile environment and ready to tackle the most complex technical challenges.    Your mission \uD83D\uDC47  You will join the data-science team based in Paris and be responsible for designing awesome machine learning algorithms and deploying them in a constrained dynamic environment with tough competition.  We train our models in Google Cloud Platform with billions of logs, and serve them in our own data centers. We use Google Dataflow, AI Platform and Tensorflow. Our neural networks generate 1 million predictions per second, each prediction processed in less than 2 ms.  You will have the chance to work on all kinds of machine learning problems (classification/regressions, time series, NLP, recommandation, reinforcement learning...) with all the data you can dream of (even more than that ;) ) and see the impact of your work every day. What you'll do ✏️ Translate business problems and feature needs to machine learning problems Design deep learning algorithms to enhance our products Implement always-on training pipelines in GCP with the help of the ML engineers Investigate and fix production problems of our models Keep learning on the latest technologies by discussing academic papers with the team, benchmarking open-source models, illimited access to Coursera... About you \uD83D\uDCAA Young PhD Graduate in a scientific discipline (first job) (Minimum qualifications) Product-focused mindset: deliver real deep learning to solve our customers problems Familiarity with deep learning frameworks Knowledge developing performant Python code Understanding of data structures and algorithm complexity (Prefered qualifications) Young PhD Graduate in machine learning, statistic, control theory or computer science (first job) Proficiency in an object oriented language like Java or Scala Personal projects demonstrating your self-learning skills Experience in designing ML models with Google Cloud Platform products including but not limited: AI Platform, BigQuery and Dataflow   \uD83D\uDC4B About us   Equativ is the new single name for Smart Adserver, DynAdmic, LiquidM and Nowtilus — four proven innovators in advertising technology. The vertically integrated company provides brand and privacy-safe solutions that empower its clients to achieve maximum impact while respecting the rights of consumers. The union combines client expertise and engineering excellence to serve the interests of both the supply- side and demand-side with equal professionalism and technical sophistication.  Headquartered in Paris and New York, Equativ operates globally with a team of more than 550 people in 20 offices. Equativ offers the market its own independent ad server, SSP, buyer tools, and media services to fulfill the promise of advertising technology. Learn more at Equativ.com.  The company is ranked on the Deloitte Technology Fast 500 EMEA and in the Financial Times’ FT 1000: Europe’s Fastest-Growing Companies. Equativ (formerly Smart AdServer) has been awarded the HappyIndex@Work label and is proud to be among the best companies in the ChooseMyCompany ranking, recognized for its flexible working environment. Come and lead the charge with us in building a transparent ecosystem based on quality! -    Equativ is an equal opportunity employer. Equal access to employment, services, and programs are available to everyone, regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, or Veteran status. If you require reasonable accommodation throughout the application and/or interview process, please contact the recruitment team at ta-team@equativ.com

Missions et responsabilités As a member of the TIP/SG Glass & Glassolutions Technical Direction, you will be in charge of “rollout and support of Industry 4.0 and automation solutions”: eMarking project with significant operational impact throughout Glass Industry production sites and their customers (Glass Solutions, Sekurit and external customers), and also OEEWEB and Process Vision: Two solutions highly spread on several Saint Gobain Business and external customers. Your responsibilities are as follows:Overview and secure the eMarking operation on our upstream production lines and downstream cutting lines both for existing running installations and the new ones inside and outside Saint Gobain.Overview and secure OEEWEB and PROCESS VISION inside and outside Saint Gobain business both for existing running installations and the new ones.For those tools, manage the hot-line service and coordinate trouble shooting which involves the central IT team, technical local teams on multiple sites and the equipment suppliersWork closely with the solution’s project leaders and development teams to improve the design and robustness of the solutions based on new customer needs and experience from running lines Profil recherché For that position we are looking for an individual with the following skills and experience:Automation engineer with strong interest in instrumentation including optics/vision, Industrial IT (Profinet, TCPIP), server administration (SQL/MySQL db), Automation (Siemens TIA portal, grafcet, ladder), SCADA (Ignition) and IoT (OPC UA, I/O Link, MQTT).Advanced analytical, conceptual and technical problem-solving abilities.Takes ownership in the coordination of action plan leading to the relevant solution.Data collection & analytics usage to identify process variability and propose automation program modifications/process design improvements in order to improve productivity/quality.Excellent communication skills, be sensitive to local environment specificities and difficulties; adapt your contribution level to local needs and competencies. Be result oriented and take ownership.This offer is open to all talents! Saint Gobain is committed to equal opportunities on a daily basis. We pay particular attention to inclusion and diversity, https://www.saint-gobain.com/fr/news/agir-durablement The Trust Empowerment and Collaboration (TEC) culture is the foundation on which our diversity and inclusion initiatives are built. Description additionnelle (contexte, évolution ...)Mobility requested: 30% in France & Europe, possibly outside Europe.Position is based at Thourotte (France, Oise), location of TIP Industry 4.0, eMarking Team Qui sommes-nous ? As a global leader in lightweight and sustainable construction, Saint-Gobain operates in 75 countries with over 166,000 employees. Saint-Gobain designs, manufactures, and distributes materials and services for the construction and industrial markets. These solutions can be found everywhere in our living and daily environments: in buildings, transportation, infrastructure, and numerous industrial applications. Joining Saint-Gobain means getting access to an exciting and rewarding career path. As a world-renowned company, you'll have the opportunity to join an international community with incredible prospects. It's also the opportunity to work and progress alongside leading professionals in your field in an international context. The main missions of the Technology and Industrial Performance Central Team are to provide support to the countries and businesses within the Group on the following activities: industrial roadmaps (standards, benchmarking, performance, energy, CO2, savings, etc.), R&D programs for the Construction business, strategic investments and purchasing, allocation of capacity between countries and operational excellence programs with associated savings (World Class Manufacturing, World Class Supply Chain, 4.0, digital applications for industry, etc.). Avantages Need more reasons to join us? A job at Saint-Gobain also means:Numerous opportunities for professional development, Saint-Gobain is committed to offering attractive career prospects to our employees accompanied by professional training to help them develop their skills.The opportunity to directly contribute and actively participate in the advancement of our sustainable housing initiatives: 84% of our team members are motivated by the prospect of having a positive difference in the environmental footprint of our operations.An attractive remuneration package, including: bonuses, access to the Group Savings Plan as well as our profit-sharing and incentive programsA diverse array of additional perks, including company-sponsored health insurance and parental support, among others.A welcoming and collaborative work culture: more than 90% of our staff express pride in being part of the Saint-Gobain team and appreciate the positive working atmosphere.A structure that prioritizes work-life balance, offering a Quality of Work Life (QWL) agreement that permits remote work for up to two days a week.Join Saint Gobain and create the world of tomorrow, today! Job Reference: FRA24211

About ShareID provides best-in-class authentication as-a-service solution based on the official identity. We enable real time ID verification, equivalent to an ID document presentation and captured with a simple smile. We leverage cutting-edge computer vision algorithms to authenticate ID documents of 120+ countries with up to 99.9% precision level, deep learning and AI algorithms to confirm the ID document ownership and the user’s liveness. On top of that, we use our patented technology to issue a reusable digital identity without never storing the user’s personal data. We hence provide ongoing access to verifiable credentials. Our Mission Disrupt the world of authentication and bring trust to interactions between individuals and businesses while enhancing the user experience when it comes to authentication or recurrent ID verification. Our values Hard work: We believe that the best way to achieve our goals is to work hard enough to exceed them. Team work: They say two brains are better than one, imagine what a team of brains can do. Ambition: Our day-to-day is full of big challenges and we enjoy it Integrity: Honesty, trust and openness help us earn our colleagues and client’s trust We don’t fail, we learn! About our management team Sara & Sawsen built ShareID during PA4 cohort of Entrepreneur First in Station F, Paris. Their background? Sara is a financial and statistical engineer from Paris Dauphine with 9+ years’ experience in risk related regulatory requirements. Before ShareID, she founded an internal startup within a large French bank and solo founded a risk management startup. Sawsen is a PhD in computer vision from Centrale Lyon with an academical background. She worked within Cisco Innovation lab on security personal data protection. Job Description Your responsibilities You will be in charge of : The design of encryption and hashing algorithms The implementation of “homomorphic encryption algorithms” Follow the latest published research and inform the team of potential new applications Design robust tests and benchmarks to validate your research Preferred Experience We are looking for a cryptography Engineer with: Masters or PhD in a relevant field Strong understanding of security for privacy-preserving techniques and Cryptographic problem solving (MPC, HE, FE, others)

Quarkslab is a privately held company founded in 2011 with currently more than 100 employees. The company focuses on vulnerability research, reverse engineering and design of security solutions and has developed leading software in the area of threat detection and code/data protection. Quarkslab provides a broad set of products and services based on deep knowledge in the area of Cybersecurity. Job description At Quarkslab, almost all of the infrastructure is managed (and hosted) internally. We operate our own in-house server infrastructure, which allows us to ensure total control of our data from hardware to applications. The information system itself is growing, both in terms of the number of physical sites, machines, VMs, services... Our internal infrastructure has been put to the test in order to quickly adapt to the new and growing needs of the development teams: continuous integration servers, test servers, code hosting, Docker image servers, automated deployment of virtual machines, and much more, all with strong security constraints. Exceptionally, we also deploy some services on cloud providers when required by specific missions or projects or when we are unable to provide an equivalent service in-house. Some examples: OS: Debian / Ubuntu Virtualization stack: oVirt / KVM / TrueNAS / Proxmox Backups: Borg Containers: Docker / Kubernetes Monitoring: Prometheus / Grafana / Icinga / LibreNMS Logging: Loki / ELK Automation: Ansible Network: JuneOS / EdgeOS / Cisco Repositories: GitLab DCIM / IPAM: NetBox Your main activities with the rest of the IT and infrastructure team is to keep Quarkslab's infrastructure working in production, deploy new services and provide L1/L2 support to all employees for computer issues and in accessing our services. Why work at Quarkslab? Work with an amazing team, eager to learn and play with new approaches and technologies, mixing various skills (security, compilation, program analysis, reverse engineering, software engineering). International environment with offices in Paris, Rennes and Buenos Aires (team croissants vs. team asado). Attend conferences in your field, learn from many internal events (weekly conference, trainings, research activities). Contribute and support Open Source Software: our own tools and other people’s projects. Flexible work hours, work from home. Premium health insurance. Technologies used are mainly open-source. The emphasis is on stability, maintainability, automation and security. Our recruitment process: Call with our Talent Acquisition Manager. Video call with the Hiring Manager. Do a short challenge Interview with Core Infra team, Security Office, QLab Leader & Pentest Manager at Quarkslab’s Office (or remote). HR debrief and job offer. Quarkslab is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability or gender identity. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know and we will be happy to accommodate. Profile List of desirable skills and knowledge: Knowledge with installation and administration of Linux servers (preferably Debian based), from low-level to applications and services, with a focus on security Good experience with virtualization technologies (eg. oVirt, Proxmox, QEMU/KVM) and containerization (Docker) Knowledge of a scripting language (Python or Bash) Knowledge of a configuration management tool (preferably Ansible) Knowledge of git Understanding of the operation of common services: DNS, DHCP, LDAP, firewalling… Networking: VLAN, VPN, routing Administration of Linux, Windows and macOS workstations It would also be nice if you have: Experience in physical server management (hardware, racking, IPMI, etc.) Experience in physical and virtual network management (cabling, DCIM/IPAM, etc.) Experience in using and managing Kubernetes clusters Experience in managing Office 365/Azure tenants Strong interest in computer security Soft skills Ability to read, write, and discuss in French and English Interest in understanding, fully solving and document the problems encountered so that they do not reoccur Be able to work autonomously Eager to help others and share knowledge, both in technical and non-technical terms Service oriented mindset But above all, the desire to progress both personally and as a team!

Hawkcell is a pioneering company dedicated to advancing animal imaging through cutting-edge AI and medical imaging technologies. Our mission is to transform patient care by enhancing diagnostic accuracy and efficiency. With a strong focus on research and development, we continuously push the boundaries of medical imaging. Born from French scientific excellence and the CNRS (National Centre for Scientific Research), HawkCell boasts a team of 70% scientists and has developed patented technology that offers unprecedented MRI image quality for animals. Having secured €5 million in Series A funding in early 2024, we aim to expand internationally (NORAM & APAC) to become the leader in animal imaging. In 2022, our market was valued at over $1 billion with double-digit annual growth. Our diverse team, composed of experts from various fields and backgrounds, collaborates to create impactful products. Headquartered in Lyon and with a global market presence, we seek candidates eager to shape the future of healthcare internationally. Join our passionate Hawkstars and make a difference, one image at a time! We are looking for a talented and motivated Senior Full Stack Engineer & DevOps with a strong emphasis on C++ to join our dynamic tech team. You will work on developing and maintaining our core applications, ensuring high performance and responsiveness to requests from the front-end. Due to our consistent growth, we are seeking to expand our AI team of 5 to 8 people, including Data scientists and an AI Product owner. Ready to join our team? We strive to build a diverse, inclusive and collaborative workplace and we follow a fair, objective, and non-discriminatory recruitment process. All applications will be considered for employment regardless of nationality, culture, or any other personal characteristics.

Ancrées dans les territoires et organisées en mode agile, les entreprises de VINCI Energies rendent les infrastructures d’énergie, de transport et de communication, les usines, les bâtiments et les systèmes d’information chaque jour plus fiables, plus sûrs, plus efficients.https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=woiUBqTQBVIActeur de la transition énergétique et numérique au sein des territoires, Citeos pour répondre aux enjeux complexes des villes.Pour renforcer l’équipe développant nos solutions de supervision d’infrastructures pour la transition énergétique sociale et environnementale des villes, Northflank is a cutting-edge cloud platform enabling developers to build and ship highly scalable, full-stack applications faster than ever before. We are a venture-backed company, and our platform is used by tens of thousands of developers worldwide in production. We are currently looking for a backend software engineer to join our team of passionate, dedicated professionals. As a backend software engineer at Northflank, you will play a crucial role in building core technology and contributing to the platform's stability, performance, and product roadmap. This position is remote. Timezone: Working hours aligned with UTC ± 2 hours Key Responsibilities: Design and implement scalable backend systems and APIs Optimize database performance and data structures Develop and maintain microservices architecture Ensure high availability and fault tolerance of our systems Collaborate with front-end developers and DevOps teams Participate in code reviews and technical discussions Requirements: 3+ years of experience in backend development Proficiency in languages such as Go, Python, or Node.js Strong knowledge of databases (SQL and NoSQL) Understanding of RESTful APIs and microservices architecture Excellent problem-solving and communication skills Preferred Qualifications: Experience with distributed systems and message queues Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, or Azure) Familiarity with containerization and orchestration (Docker, Kubernetes) Knowledge of CI/CD practices and tools Contributions to open-source projects We offer a competitive salary, equity, and benefits package, and the opportunity to be part of a fast-growing startup at the forefront of the cloud-native revolution. If you are passionate about infrastructure software and want to join a dynamic team, we’d love to hear from you! Compensation The compensation for this role will depend on a number of factors including but not limited to: skill set, experience, training, and location. The salary range is between £45k-£100k. Diversity Statement At Northflank, we are committed to fostering a culture where every individual feels valued, respected, and supported, regardless of their background or identity. We are dedicated to providing equal treatment and opportunity throughout hiring, selection, and employment regardless of gender, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, disability, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, veteran or military status, or any other legally protected category. Northflank is an equal opportunity employer. Compensation Range: £45K - £100K

WHO WE ARE At Adikteev, we fuel the app ecosystem by inspiring users to engage with the apps they know and love. Specializing in user retention, we grow in-app revenue and build user loyalty with custom retargeting and churn prediction campaigns.  HOW WE DO IT Own It, Live It: Our top priority is making sure our customers are not just happy but thrilled. We're not afraid to make bold moves, take charge of challenges, and see them through to the end.Rolling with the Changes: We don't just face challenges, we predict them. Agility is our middle name, and we're all about continuous learning. Adaptability is our recipe for success.Making Waves with Purpose: We're here to make a difference. Every decision and action we take is aimed at making a meaningful impact.The ADIKTEAM Vibe: It's not just a team; it's the ADIKTEAM. Each one of us is a crucial part of the squad and we're always on the lookout for A+ players.WHAT YOU WILL DO Take charge of our products, especially when it comes to ads bidding and users segmentation ; Team up with our team (think Backend/Frontend Devs, Data Engineers, SREs, and Product Owners) to spice up our platform, improve its performances and, let’s be honest, freshen up some outdated services (migration or redesign) ; Make sure our code is top-notch and sustainable ; Come up with cool ways to design and use development best pratiques to promote high quality software, good test coverage, peer code review, continuous integration, and rapid deployment ; Pick the right tools and tech to keep things running smoothly and speedily ; Keep our code in check and manage technical debt to address daily scaling challenge ; Keep an eye on scalability (both in tech and business) to minimize technical debt.WHO YOU ARE You will be a good fit for the Engineering team at Adikteev if you: Got solid experience with at least two programming languages, with Node.js or Go prefered ; Make sure the code is easy to test and stays consistent ; Always consider scalability in your work; Excel at troubleshooting problems when they pop up ; Enjoy working together with a team and explain the vision behind your solutions ; Know your way around at least one of the public cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or GCP). And if you've got any of these under your belt, that's even cooler: Messed around with building large-scale systems, service-oriented architecture and catching system (in memory, distributed) ; Worked with high-performance and/or low-latency system ; Know your stuff when it comes to stream processing architectures.  You've worked on maintaining or operating a production. Please note that, for legal reasons, candidates are required to hold European citizenship and/or maintain residency within the European Union in order to be considered for this position. PERKS AND BENEFITS Competitive Salary ; Performance-based Quarterly bonus with transparent KPIs; Profit-sharing scheme ("Prime de participation") ; Longevity bonus every 2 years ; Healthcare plan with excellent coverage (50% of the contribution covered by Adikteev) ; €9 Lunch Vouchers (Tickets Restaurant - SWILE card - 50% of the contribution covered by Adikteev) ; 4 1/2 days work week (Fridays afternoon off) ; “RTT” ; 50% of transportation fees covered by Adikteev (Navigo Pass) Mental Health support ; Flexible remote working policy ; Regular team-life event / activity Parental leave Policy. OUR PROCESS Call with Maxime, Talent Acquisition Partner Tech interview with Eric, Senior Backend Engineer, and Alexandre, Staff Engineer Interview with Aldenis, Head of Engineering Final interview with Cédric, CTO, and Loïc, CPO We prioritize people, not just job titles.  At Adikteev, we value talent in all its many forms and qualifications. If, after reading this job description, you feel that the position aligns with your current abilities and career aspirations, we encourage you to apply even if you don't have every skill listed.  Not everyone will make it through our hiring process, but your skills might just be the perfect match for another adventure we have now or down the road.  As an Employer of choice, Adikteev does not and shall not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, gender expression, age, national origin, disability, marital status, sexual orientation, or military status, in any of its activities or operations. These activities include, but are not limited to, hiring and firing of staff, selection of volunteers and vendors, and provision of services. We are committed to providing an inclusive and welcoming environment for all members of our staff, clients, volunteers, subcontractors, vendors and clients.

job_name: Développeur et Administrateur Big Data H/F
job_text: A propos d’O2MAX O2MAX accompagne ses clients lyonnais depuis plus de 10 ans dans la mise en œuvre et le support des nouvelles technologies au sein de leur DSI.  Notre taille humaine et notre offre locale favorise la proximité avec nos consultants et autorise une approche collaborative et agile afin de proposer des parcours de carrière personnalisés et valorisants basés sur des programmes de formation et de certification.  La diversité des compétences et des expériences de nos équipes nous permet d’apporter des solutions pertinentes à nos clients et de les accompagner de bout en bout sur des sujets d’expertise, de conseil, de développement, d’intégration et de support. Nos équipes multiculturelles portent haut les valeurs qui nous sont chers : convivialité et esprit d’équipe, exigence et bienveillance, engagement et persévérance. Et si nous parlions du poste à pourvoir ? Nous sommes sans cesse à la recherche de nos futurs (es) collègues. Aujourd’hui c’est toi qui nous intéresses, pour quel poste ? Celui de Développeur et Administrateur Big Data (H/F)  Quelles seront tes tâches quotidiennes ? Participer aux projets structurant affectés à l’équipe depuis le recueil du besoin à la recette utilisateur et son déploiement Concevoir techniquement les traitements dans le respect de l’architecture mise en place à l’Agirc-Arrco et des exigences du client ; Codifier les traitements des applications et rédiger la documentation technique dans le respect des normes de développement et des process établis à l’Agirc-Arrco ; Prendre en charge les maintenances correctives (modification d'une application existante pour corriger des erreurs techniques ou fonctionnelles) ; Réaliser les tests unitaires, pour chaque composant : nouvelle fonctionnalité et non régression, dans le cas de la maintenance ; Réaliser les tests d’assemblage des composants décrivant une fonction applicative : nouvelle fonctionnalité et non régression, dans le cas de la maintenance ; premier niveau de vérification des performances et de l’exploitabilité  Ton profil Tu es idéalement titulaire d’un Bac +4/5 en informatique et justifiant de 7 ans d'expériences minimum dans le domaine. Compétences techniques Librairies/Modules/Commandes SPARK (PySpark, SparkSQL, Spark-Shell) Requêtage SQL Administration de plateforme Hadoop Cloudera Développement d’alimentation Décisionnel (plutôt ELT) - DATASTAGE, TALEND, INFORMATICA Compétences humaines Excellent relationnel Bonne communication Esprit d’équipe Capacité d’analyse Autonomie et rigueur Force proposition  Les avantages O2MAX Nombreux secteurs d’activités Banque, Industrie, Life Sciences, Logistique, Services… ✍️ 10 ans d’existence locale Excellente connaissance du marché lyonnais Télétravail Télétravail hybride (généralement 2 à 3 jours / semaine)️ Tickets restaurant Carte Swile avec TR d’une valeur de 10,83 € / jour (dont 6,40 € pris en charge par O2max) Transport en commun 50% de l’abonnement Train/TCL pris en charge Mobilité durable Indemnité de 40€/mois pour les plus courageux Aide à la mobilité Aide de 1000€ pour un déménagement en région lyonnaiseAssistance à la recherche de logement ‍‍‍  Mutuelle avantageuse Prise en charge à 50% par O2max (gratuite pour les enfants)️ Congés 25 jours de CP12 jours de RTTPrime de vacances $$ PEE/PERCO Plans d’Épargne Entreprise et Retraite copieusement abondés par la société ‍   Plan de formation Individualisé et adapté à ton évolution professionnelle Programme d’intégration et nombreux after-work Pour te sentir bien tout de suite, et pour cultiver le sentiment d’appartenance à l’équipe O2MAX Activité physique Sport encouragé sur la pause déjeuner pour se vider la tête (douche à disposition) Une équipe au TOP qui se languit de t’accueillir ! Dans une ambiance TOUJOURS décontractée et bienveillante ;-) Le process pour nous rejoindre 1. Postule à cette annonce ou réserve sans attendre un créneau avec l’équipe RH, 2. Échange de préqualification (15 min) avec l’équipe RH, 3. Discussion avec l’Ingénieur d’Affaire en charge du domaine de compétence, 4. Évaluation de tes compétences avec un référent technique. Tu t’y vois déjà ? Nous aussi, nous avons hâte de te rencontrer

Sweep is hiring an inspiring Engineering Manager, to guide our sustainability data management platform to new heights. Beyond just technical expertise, this role is about cultivating a team of brilliant developers, setting strategic priorities, and empowering each member to shine. If you're passionate about making a difference, driving progress, and fostering a culture of excellence, seize this chance to lead with purpose and impact. Sweep maps climate and ESG data across an entire business to reduce carbon emissions, improve social and environmental performance, and create audit-ready reports to run the best sustainability programs. Climate change is the defining issue of our time. By empowering companies with technology that helps manage their climate impact, we believe Sweep can make a meaningful contribution to a better future for all of us. Ok, sounds promising. What will I be doing? We're looking for an Engineering Manager with a strong technical background and a hands-on approach to lead one of our engineering teams. You will be responsible for collaborating with Product, Design, and Carbon/ESG Experts to help build our SaaS tool that allows companies to measure and track their Carbon and ESG data, set reduction goals and report on progress towards a cleaner future. To be more specific, this includes: Driving Innovation Lead the development of new features for our core product, prioritizing security, reliability, and performance. Collaborate with the engineering team members to design and architect new systems, products, and features. Champion modern agile software development practices to continuously improve engineering and organizational standards. Mentoring Excellence Manage and mentor a dedicated group of engineers through effective hiring, coaching, and hands-on career development. Foster a collaborative engineering culture aligned with our company values.  Stakeholder Engagement Collaborate with cross-functional teams and leadership to build a cutting-edge ESG data management platform. Set and manage expectations with other engineering teams, senior management, and stakeholders.  Hands-On Approach Despite managerial responsibilities, actively engage in coding activities to stay connected with the technical aspects of the project. That's just right for me. What do I need to bring? Good you asked. Some more details on who we’re looking for: Qualifications You have 2+ years of experience in management of software engineersYou have 5+ years of technical industry experienceYou can demonstrate that your work had significant impact on product and businessYou are capable of delivering on multiple competing priorities Qualities You have experience leading a distributed team to deliver features and manage production SaaS productsYou love developing and growing people and have a track record of leading, mentoring, and coaching software engineersYou are knowledgeable and passionate about software development, ideally with experience in developing and scaling SaaS products.You have solid experience working in an agile development environmentYou have a passion for solving problems, developing the solutions and building productsYou bring all-round communication skills and an ability to work collaborativelyYou are a team player and have ability to motivate othersYou care about our mission of creating a better future for all of us Great, and what's in it for me? You will be joining an exciting young business that has the humble ambition to change the world. With a proven track record in starting companies, we’re planning to hit the ground running and have an impact fast. Joining this journey right at the beginning allows you to really help shape our path. Our hybrid work model, with hiring focussed around our head offices in Paris, London and Montpellier, allows us to balance our personal and professional lives while staying connected and engaged with colleagues and clients. We’re big believers in creating successful businesses that are good for everyone, including society and the planet. That’s why we have a B Corporation status. We think this will be the ride of our lives. And maybe yours, too. At Sweep, we are dedicated to promoting diversity, inclusion, and equality. We believe that a diverse talent pool drives performance and sparks innovative ideas. We ensure equal opportunities for everyone, free from discrimination. Join our team and help build a sustainable future where everyone can thrive! Benefits (non-exhaustive list) Lunch voucherHealth insurance entirely free for you and your familyRTTTrust and flexible working hoursPersonal development training fundGlobal and team offsitesHybrid environment (At least 1 day per week at the office) This is a full-time position based in one of our French hubs (Paris or Montpellier). Although there are job openings in both cities, only one position is available.

Job Title: Backend Software Engineer Lead  Type: Full-time  Location: London, Madrid, or Paris  What about us? Welcome to INFINIT, a global tech company supercharging SMEs in select verticals with a unified platform that combines AI-powered business services with banking, operating systems, and deep industry expertise. Our mission is to help businesses grow simply by offering a comprehensive suite of solutions tailored to their unique needs.  At INFINIT, we are transforming vertical banking for SMEs with our advanced technology and industry knowledge, delivering solutions that drive growth and efficiency. We pride ourselves on innovation, transparency, and building strong relationships with our clients.  Join us at INFINIT as we reshape the landscape of business services, making a positive impact on the global economy. Your adventure in fintech starts here!  Join our team specializing in financing, payment, B2B, and B2C solutions for small and medium-sized businesses. As Backend Lead, you will collaborate closely with front-end developers, project managers, and fellow back-end developers to architect and maintain robust server-side applications. What do we want to achieve together? Backend Development Leadership: Lead the backend development efforts, leveraging your expertise in designing and implementing high-quality solutions using C# and .NET. Your leadership will ensure the scalability, reliability, and security of our applications. Collaborative Integration: Work closely with front-end developers and other teams to seamlessly integrate backend functionalities, ensuring smooth and efficient application performance. Technical Solution Design: Participate in the design and architecture of technical solutions that meet business requirements, emphasizing scalability, performance, and maintainability. Security Compliance: Ensure compliance with financial data security and privacy standards, implementing robust measures to protect sensitive information. Documentation: Write and maintain comprehensive technical documentation to facilitate knowledge sharing and ensure clarity across the development team. What do you need to be successful in this role? Experience: Proven experience in backend development using C# and .NET, with a strong track record of delivering scalable and secure solutions. Team Collaboration: Ability to work effectively in a team environment, collaborating with cross-functional teams and communicating proficiently in English. Best Practices: Knowledge of web development best practices and standards, ensuring adherence to industry norms. RESTful Web Services: Experience in integrating RESTful web services to enable seamless communication between frontend and backend systems. Fintech Experience: Experience in the fintech industry is advantageous, bringing an understanding of financial systems and requirements. What will you find working at Infinit? Inspiring Mission: We are dedicated to revolutionizing business financing and making a positive impact on the European economy. Your work at Infinit will have a lasting effect on businesses and communities.Diverse and Inclusive Team: Join a dynamic and international team of over 7 nationalities. You'll have the chance to work with experienced professionals from around the world, fostering a rich learning environment.Flexibility and Ownership: We trust our team and we are goal-oriented.Competitive salary and stock options: We offer highly competitive salaries and equity, because we're building this together.Day off on your birthday: We celebrate it with you.Flexible Benefits: Access Flexible Retribution benefits through a convenient mobile app, Cobee.Quality Time Together: We foster a sense of community with annual gatherings and bi-weekly office team gatherings. You're more than welcome to join us for quality time.Health and Well-being: Your health matters to us. You will have access to top-quality Medical & Mental Health Insurance.Personal Time Off: Enjoy flexibility with your personal time off. Diversity & Inclusion Infinit promotes an inclusive culture that seeks equity and values different perspectives. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic.

À propos de nous QUI EST PARLYM ? Le Groupe PARLYM c'est un acteur majeur de l'ingénierie industrielle, qui développe son expertise depuis plus de 50 ans. En constante croissante, nous sommes fiers aujourd'hui de compter plus de 1 000 collaborateurs à travers le monde, qui réalisent des projets clefs en main dans des secteurs clefs et stratégiques: Nucléaire, Industrie, Oil & Gas, Défense, Pharma et Energies Renouvelables. POURQUOI PARLYM ? C'est Intégrer une culture d'entreprise forte de la performance, C'est évoluer au sein d'un environnement multiculturel - C'est participer à la dynamique du Groupe au sein d'équipes jeunes et dynamiques - C'est être acteur et avoir un réel impact sur les enjeux énergétiques et industriels de demain - C'est concevoir et réaliser des projets d'envergures à forte valeur ajoutée. Mission Pour relever ces défis notre Division Engineering & Projets, sous la responsabilité du Responsable du Pôle Ingénierie & Projets, un: LEAD PROCESS ENGINEER en CDI basé au siège à Marseille - Expert technique, Manager d'une équipe et responsable du développement de son activité. REJOIGNEZ PARLYM ! Garant(e) & Responsable Technique du Département Process : Assurer la conduite des études process dans toutes leurs phases : faisabilité, APS, APD, exécution des travaux. Mettre en œuvre les outils et logiciels adaptés aux besoins des projets Rédiger / faire rédiger et vérifier les data sheets & notes de calcul des équipements à produire. Réaliser des bilans (matière, énergie, utilités...) Réaliser / exploiter / commenter des PFD's et P&ID's Superviser le suivi et la qualité documentaire du projet (vérification/approbation), Assurer l’élaboration et la mise à jour des analyses des risques, HAZID, HAZOP Rédiger / superviser / valider la production des livrables de sa spécialité (notices – fiches techniques – notes de calcul – éventuellement plans et schémas), Préparer les Plans de Prévention – animer les réunions de présentation des risques projet (QHSE) aux intervenants - Assurer les délais/ coûts des projets confiés Anticiper, solutionner et Informer les parties prenantes des projets des impacts techniques, planning, ressources et moyens des opérations sous sa responsabilité. We're on a mission to help engineers understand and scale their systems, applications, and teams. We operate at high scale — trillions of data points per day — allowing for seamless collaboration and problem-solving among Dev, Ops and Security teams globally for tens of thousands of companies. Our engineering culture values pragmatism, honesty, and simplicity to solve hard problems the right way. At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them. The Team: Datadog Application Security Management (ASM) allows customers to manage application security risk with continuous, real-time monitoring of vulnerabilities and threats against your web applications, serverless applications, and APIs, in production. Automatically integrated with Application Performance Monitoring (APM) distributed tracing and code-level context, Application Security Management empowers development, operations, and security teams to build and run secure applications in production. The Opportunity: We are looking for a software engineer to work on our open-source Go library. On top of working on the daily life of this open-source project, it includes working on the development and integration of our security monitoring features, such as the detection of attacks or exploits, thanks to the "security engine" built inside the library. Last but not least, it also involves making the onboarding experience easier and more seamless, collaborating with the Go ecosystem and language. Come and join us to build amazing open-source software! What You'll Do:Develop mainly in Go.Instrument Go source code at compilation time to be able to monitor Go services at run time.Contribute to the architecture, design and implementation of ASM for Go.Work closely with the many ASM library teams (1 per language we support) through working groups (aka squads) and RFCs.Collaborate with the ASM backend teams on new product ideas.Ensure that your quality criterias are met thanks to our shared testing platform, health metrics, performance monitoring metrics, etc.Write code that instruments thousands of Go services around the world.Learn about the Go internals and its runtime.Closely collaborate with the Datadog Go Library Squad, including the APM Go Tracing and Go Profiling teams. Who You Are:You have professional experience programming in Go, or polyglot with no trouble adjusting to Go. For each language you know, you think idiomatically to leverage the best features of the language for a particular problem.You have experience with compiled languages.You have experience with multi-threading, concurrency and parallelism.You favor readable, robust, reliable code and put that in practice by writing clean, correct, tested, performant, and idiomatic code.You have experience with Go packages and modules, and their maintenance, such as releasing them or updating go.mod files.You care about performance, both in regard to time and space, and have experience in measuring and optimizing code to that end.You keep yourself up to date in library ecosystems and language communities, and you're not afraid to dive into the code of your dependencies to get the best understanding of their behavior.You work openly and collaboratively with your colleagues.You have a BS/MS/PhD in a CS/STEM field or equivalent experience.Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you're passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply. Bonus Points:You're a fluent Go programmer: you avoid pitfalls and quirks of the language like callback hell, object mutation, and tricky asynchronous code; you dived into some of the Go internals; you use modern syntax and language features.You have experience with widely used Go web frameworks (like gorilla, gin, echo, chi…).You keep yourself up-to-date regarding the Go language, its ecosystem and community.You have experience interfacing Go with foreign code thanks to CGO.You have experience with code rewriting, AST transformation, or compilers.You have experience with GitHub and GitHub Actions.You have experience in maintaining open source projects.You have experience with customer support. Benefits and Growth:Skilled, knowledgeable, and kind teammates to work with and learn from.Interesting challenges of all sorts. You'll gain experience with runtime internals, low level OS details, and how to safely ship software that runs within customer processes at scale.Opportunities to contribute to open source software.You'll have a lot of influence on product direction and impact on the business, especially since we continue to grow quickly.Competitive global benefits.Continuous professional development. Benefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog. Application Performance Management (APM) is the next step in observability, and this role is responsible for enabling customers to use Datadog with a variety of APM solutions. The role knits together a combination of scale and embracing new standards – like OpenTelemetry – to allow customers more diversity in how they instrument their applications. The team is responsible for ingesting all of the tracing data that is received by Datadog, and providing it to every downstream system. You'll be working closely with the instrumentation ecosystem, and you'll be working closely with the Datadog product teams that consume the data. As many projects will cross team boundaries inside Datadog, the role will allow you to contribute to many high profile projects and lead what data is collected and how it is used inside the rest of the datadog product. At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships that it builds, the creativity it brings to the table, and the collaboration of being together. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our employees can create a work-life harmony that best fits them. What You'll Do:Manage and grow a team of 7 engineers that own and operate the services responsible for data ingestion and billing. Partner with product management to define and prioritize features that unlock value and new instrumentation opportunities. Ensure the reliability, scalability, and performance of the APM Intake distributed systems. Create a strong team culture aligned with our engineering standards and our customer focus Who You Are:A Software Engineer at heart with a previous experience leading software engineering teams, as a tech lead or people manager. Excellent leader with strong interpersonal skills, and the ability to build and lead high-performing teams Strong understanding of Kafka, RabbitMQ, and streaming or event-driven architectures. Hands-on experience with Java or Go, and a willingness to spend some time with hands on keyboard, and participate in an on-call rotation. You have a track record of delivering high-quality software products on schedule and collaborating closely with product partners. Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you're passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply. job_name: Ingénieur traitement du signal et données F/H
job_text: L'entreprise Créée en 2015, la société rennaise a développé un nouveau système de surveillance maritime par satellite et commercialise les données collectées auprès des États, des assurances ou encore l’ensemble des acteurs du secteur maritime. Fondée par trois frères, Unseenlabs compte aujourd’hui quatre-vingts collaborateurs et une flotte de treize satellites. Description du poste Au sein de notre pôle Software, vous intégrerez l'équipe Algorithmie afin d’améliorer la qualité de notre traitement de données et de l’accélérer. Vous aurez pour mission principale de créer des algorithmes capables d’analyser un signal radio fréquence. Ces programmes doivent permettre d’organiser, transformer et donner du sens aux données recueillies par nos satellites. Plus précisément, vous serez en charge de/d':Elaborer les algorithmes pour le traitement de signal RF afin de les implémenter dans des logicielsSavoir optimiser ces algorithmes, entre autres en les parallélisantÉtudier les algorithmes existants et les corriger, les faire évoluer pour intégrer de nouvelles fonctionnalités ou les améliorer pour renforcer leur performance (niveau de catégorisation, vitesse d’exécution).Effectuer une veille technologique pour détecter de nouvelles idées d’algorithmes dans la littérature académique ou une nouvelle organisation de traitement pour réduire le temps d’exécution Profil recherché Compétences :Expertise en mathématiques appliquées (traitement signal et statistiques)Maitrise du langage Python et de librairies de calcul scientifiqueExpérience dans le développement logiciel backend et le traitement de signal, idéalement RFForte expertise de l’algorithmie et du traitement des donnéesVous faites preuve de curiosité et êtes proactif pour apporter de nouvelles idées d’algorithmieVous êtes rigoureux, faites preuve de discrétion et êtes doté d'une forte autonomieIdéalement, vous disposez :D'une connaissance des langages C et C++ ou RustD'une connaissance en Machine Learning et reconnaissance signalD'une maitrise de l’optimisation numérique De bonnes raisons de nous rejoindre ?Travailler dans un secteur technologique innovant au sein d’une équipe de passionnésFaire partie d’une aventure entrepreneuriale à succèsPorter des projets à impacts internationauxIntégrer une société où expertise et bienveillance sont indissociables Modalités du postePoste en CDI, à pourvoir à Cesson-Sévigné (35)Tickets restaurants pris en charge à 60%Mutuelle familiale prise en charge à 100%Prime annuelle de 800€Télétravail ponctuel possible

Mago is a software that transforms and stylizes any type of video into any aesthetic: paintings, anime, cyberpunk... It is designed as an AI-native tool for video production workflows, dramatically lowering the cost per minute of stylized content across genres like anime, sci-fi, or historical fiction.  We're seeking a talented Senior Frontend Developer to join our team and help build the foundation of our innovative video stylization / AI rendering technology.  Tasks Drive excellent user experience, continually improving functionality, usability, and simplicityImplement, update, and maintain features and user interfaces for our video processing and AI rendering toolIntegrate and automate frontend tests (including end-to-end tests) and add logging and monitoring to the frontend stackProvide leadership and mentorship to other team membersCollaborate with Backend and ML teams to deliver compelling user-facing productsDesign efficient and reusable frontend systems that power complex web applicationsIdentify and resolve performance and scalability issuesWork cross-functionally to define problems, collect data, build analytical models, and develop highly scalable solutionsWork closely with UX/UI to ensure seamless integration of designsHelp build and maintain a well-documented Design System Requirements  What We're Looking For:5+ years of experience in Frontend EngineeringStrong proficiency in React (Hooks, Suspense, etc.)Ability to carry a frontend testing strategyStrong skills in integrating APIs, caching, and state managementProficiency in frontend optimizations and performance tuning Bonus Qualifications:Experience working with video editing software or 3D animation toolsKnowledge of film production and 3D animation DCC (Unreal Engine, Blender, After Effects…)Familiarity with Stable Diffusion and AI-driven image/video generationKnowledge of backend languages, particularly GoAbility to thrive in a dynamic startup environment Benefits  What We Offer:Hybrid work based in our Paris headquartersOpportunity to work on cutting-edge AI video technologyDiverse responsibilities across internal tools and client-facing appsOwnership and empowerment in your projects from development to productionIntegration into a small, dynamic team of engineers Benefits Equity grant to reflect your impact as a core member of the companyFull health, dental, and vision coverage30 days of paid time off Why Join Us? Build the foundations of Mago: As a Senior Frontend Engineer, you'll have a significant impact on the infrastructure and foundations of our innovative services.Work on unique technology: Help us create the most powerful and effective AI-driven video transformation technology of the decade.Join at a pivotal time: We're in an exciting phase of growth and product development, offering you the opportunity to shape what we build and how we grow. Think you're up for the challenge? We'd love to hear from you and see what magic we can create together. Our recruitment process includes:  1. Initial interview with our CEO 2. Technical interview with our CTO, including an on-site technical test 3. Final face to face interview with our CEO  We look forward to hearing from you!
